loans.use: To buy welding tools and other supplies to sell.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Сайёра трудолюбивая добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Муж является рабочим. Более 13 лет она занимается купле- продажей скота на скотном рынке. Она откармливает их в течении 3- 4 недель, а затем продает их за выгодную цену. Сайёра запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса и улучшения благосостоянии семьи.
texts.en: Sayora is a hardworking, kind and goal-oriented woman.  She is married and is raising three children.  Her husband is a worker.  Sayora has been involved in buying and selling livestock at a livestock market for over 13 years.  She fattens up livestock for 3-4 weeks and then sells it at a profitable price.  Sayora is requesting a loan in the sum of 5000 Somoni to purchase livestock in order to expand her business and improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma, 45 years old, is married and has 4 children whose ages range from 10 to 20 years. He describes himself as a focused man. Juma operates a farm where he sells produce such as cabbages, tomatoes, etc. He has been involved in this business for 15 years and employs 3 people. Juma's business is located in a very productive area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor road networks, making it difficult to distribute farm produce to his customers. Juma will use this KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lantern for his family members to use for lighting.

This is Juma's fifth loan with SMEP DTM. His business goal is to increase farm production within 5 years. He hopes, in the future, to introduce modern farming techniques to his business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a business, selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. She earns additional income from selling kitchen wares and ready-to-wear clothes. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF, to buy additional empty three-gallon bottles, which she will refill with purified drinking water to sell to her customers.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva lenders. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional empty three-gallon bottles, which she will refill with purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Graciano

texts.es:
El socio Graciano se dedica al negocio de construccion,el socio hace trabajos como pintados de casa y construcciones,el socio es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este trabajo quiere sacar adelante a su familia.El socio solicita el credito para comprar herramientas como pinturas y brochas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Graciano works in construction. He provides house painting and construction services. He is a hard-working person, who wants to provide for his family through his work. 

He is requesting a loan to buy tools such as paints and paintbrushes.

He is happy for the loan and is committed to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy tools such as paints and paintbrushes.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 35 years old, married and has seven children, five of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets and sacks of feeds.

Mary Jane has been pig fattening for 30 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and sacks of feeds

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Soraya se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive don Carlos, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. La mujer es comerciante. 
Carlos es un hombre que le gusta trabajar para sacar adelante a su familia, el trabaja en una fábrica en Manta, pero también para generara mejores recursos también se dedica junto a la mujer al comercio, ellos venden ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, su mujer sale casi todos los días y el por su parte vende en su lugar de trabajo a compañeros y los fines de semana sale junto a su mujer a vender y cobrar ya que dejan a crédito y cobran cada 8 días. Ellos  llevan más de 15 años dedicados a esta actividad la cual le deja buenos ingresos.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños y otras prendas. Lleva 3 años  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.

loans.use: comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños y otras prendas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shaving equipment.

loans.name: Tuloto

texts.en:
Tuloto is married and lives with her husband and 5 children in the village of Aele-Fou where peanut farming is one of the oldest trades.  She and her husband do not currently earn enough to feed, school and clothe their children.

She set up a small business in a field that she has experience in (peanut farming), in order to improve her family's standard of living.  She loves her children dearly and wants to give them something to live for when they grow older.  All her efforts are for her children's future.

She is applying for a loan of $650 from the SPBDF to purchase peanut seeds and fertilizer to start her own business.

loans.use: Buy bags of peanut seeds and fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Safie

texts.en: Safie lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with her children because she is widow whose husband died in sickness. Now she is supporting her family. She is uneducated and she is a carpenter. She works with all the members of her family in her house. She wants to take a group loan to buy new carpentry tools and all the equipment that she needs to expand her business and make a better life for her family. She is very happy with this loan.

loans.use: To buy new carpentry tools

loans.name: Damla Marie

texts.fr:
Miss Damla Marie L., 24, had to leave school and began to support herself by running a little general store. A hard worker, she manages her little store competently, earning in a small income from it.

She does not have enough money to expand her shelves, so she is asking for a loan of $300 that will allow her to maintain a more consistent inventory and thus satisfy the needs of her customers. This will permit her to be financially independent.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 24 ans, Mlle L. Damla Marie a abandonnée ses études et s’est lancée dans le commerce des produits de premières nécessités afin de subvenir à ses besoins. Très dévouée elle arrive à bien gérer son commerce ce qui lui procure le minimum de revenu.

Ses moyens sont insuffisants pour augmenter la taille de son étalage, elle sollicite un appui financier de $300 pour s’approvisionner et avoir un stock plus consistant afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra d’avoir une autonomie financière.

loans.use: increase her inventory for her general store

loans.name: Valasi

texts.en: Ms Valasi is a young lady of twenty four years of age; she has just finished school but has no job. She decided to take frying pancakes as her business, which will be easy to achieve as it was one of her experiences from her home economics class in school. She used all her 1st loan of $300 to buy the ingredients needed for this particular business and she hopes that this will help her to get some money for her personal needs and for paying her weekly repayments. She is very happy with the program and wishes to get another loan to improve her business.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for the business

loans.name: Justina Eustaquia

texts.es:
Justina is a loving and hard-working mother of three small children and for four years she has been selling Andean products (potato starch, quinoa, potatoes and barley) in a very popular market in Juliaca, the city where she lives. The business generates an acceptable amount of money and allows her to cover the basic needs of her household.

She begins to sell her products every day at 7:00am and finishes at 5:00pm, six days a week, working every day to give her children a higher quality of life and, most importantly, education so that in the future they can grow to be men that are useful in their communities.

In order to achieve these goals she would like to increase the quantity of merchandise and in this way increase her income. For this reason she is asking for a loan that she will invest in her business, which she promises to repay in no more than six months.

“She will keep working hard, but without your help she will not be able to achieve her goals, and for this reason she hopes for your generous support.”

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Justina es una amorosa y trabajadora madre de tres pequeños niños y hace más de cuatro años se dedica a la comercialización de productos andinos (chuño, quinua, papa y cebada), en un mercado muy popular de la ciudad donde vive, Juliaca, negocio que le genera ingresos económicos aceptables y le permite cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.

Ella empieza diariamente a ofrecer sus productos desde las 7:00 de la mañana y culmina a las 5:00 de la tarde durante 6 días a la semana y se esfuerza día a día con el propósito de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños y sobre todo educación para que en el futuro se desenvuelvan como hombres de bien útiles a su comunidad.

Para lograr sus objetivos desea aumentar la cantidad de su mercadería y así obtener mayor beneficio económico, para esto solicita un préstamo que invertirá en su negocio y promete reembolsar el dinero en un lapso no mayor a seis meses.

“Seguirá trabajando arduamente, pero sin tu ayuda no podrá cumplir sus metas, por eso espera tu generoso apoyo”

loans.use: Obtain a greater quantity and quality of products to sell in the different markets of her beautiful city.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.pt:
Beatriz B., holder of Passport No. AB 226509, 38 years of age and a resident of the Laulane / 3 de fevereiro neighborhood, is married with 1 child and lives in her own home. She will begin the program by borrowing 6,000 MT to be repaid in 6 months. She sells clothing and is a traveling saleswoman. She plans to use the loan to invest in the business.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Beatriz B., portadora do passapot nº AB 226509, de 38 anos de idade residente no bairro Laulane / 3 de fevereiro, casada e tem 1 filho casa propria esta a iniciar no programa, vai tomar 6000 para pagar em 6 meses ,vende Roupas é vendedora ambulante e com o valor que vai tomar pretende Investir no negocio

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde A. sells clothes- all types of clothes, but mainly junior and kids clothes on foot. She is one of the bulk salespeople in the area, buying and selling by the dozen. To date, she totals 6 months of work in this trade, making trips to Oruro, Potosí, and on occasion, all of the interior to buy merchandise to sell. Clotilde is in need of capital in order to increase and improve her sales, with the goal of bettering her income and be able to establish a retail shop which will be an important tool for end of the year sales.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Clotilde A., se dedica a la venta de ropa, todo tipo de ropa, pero principalmente ropa juvenil y ropa para niños de forma ambulante, es una de las mayoristas de la zona, comprando y vendiendo por docena En la actualidad ya suman 6 meses de trabajo en el rubro realizando viajes tanto a Oruro, Potosí, y en ocasiones a todo el interior para poder comprar la mercadería para la venta. Clotilde precisa de capital para poder incrementar y mejorar su mercadería, con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y poder instalar su puesto de venta, que será una herramienta importante para la venta de fin de año.

loans.use: Clotilde is in need of capital in order to increase and improve her sales, with the goal of bettering her income and be able to establish a retail shop which will be an important tool for end of the year sales.

loans.name: Kyaliwajala C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jane A.. She runs a retail store and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to increase stock. Jane is 42 years old and a single mother of three children ranging in age from 15 to 22. Her children go to school. Each week, Jane makes approximately UGX 80,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to finish her residential house, which is under construction. Jane has received a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600,000 to invest in the retail store business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jane is joined in her small group by Dorothy T., Jane N., Grace N., and Rose N.. Dorothy T. and Jane N. sell clothes and are requesting loans of UGX 800,000 and UGX 400,000 to add to their stock and expend their clothing businesses. Grace N. rears poultry and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to purchase more chicks. Rose N. runs a canteen and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy a fridge.

loans.use: To increase her store's stock

loans.name: Iraq's Tujitume. Group

texts.en:
Iraq is 27 years old and is a single woman with a four-year-old child. Iraq began selling clothes and ice cream in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales. Iraq now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mwajuma, Anna, and Fatuma.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.en:
Koffi K. is 34 years old and is the married father of one child. He owns a photocopying and typing services business in Adèta, a medium-sized town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. As most people in his area do not own computers or copy machines or know how to type, his services are often in demand and keep him very busy.

With this loan, Koffi hopes to buy another photocopy machine, as his current one can barely keep up with his workload. He also wishes to buy a few reams of paper. Koffi hopes that with this loan he will be able to satisfy the demands of his customers and to use the revenue from his business to pay for his child’s schooling.

loans.use: To buy paper and a new photocopy machine

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.en:
Porfirio Nunez Carmona is married to Sinforosa Riquelme, and they live in Horqueta. The couple has 13 sons, but only 3 of them are under Porfirio and Sinforosa’s care; the rest are economically independent.

Porfirio works as director in construction. With the income generated by this job, he was able to raise and educate 13 children.

In 2006 Porfirio became a client of Fundacion Paraguaya since he formed a committee of entrepreneuring men. Because of his punctual repayments in previous loans, Porfirio is considered a very trustworthy costumer by Fundacion Paraguaya.

The money provided by the credit will be used in the purchase of raw materials and tools for construction.

loans.use: purchase of raw materials and tools for construction

loans.name: Wellinton

texts.es:
Wellinton is a selfless father and a loving husband who sacrifices himself daily in order to ensure his small daughter and dear wife’s well-being. With the aim of acquiring the medicine necessary for the well-being of Delia – he toils daily in his fields, and even more so when the time for harvesting arrives as the swift gathering of his crops guarantees their immediate sale. He has ambitions to improve his work and produce with better tools, manures and fertilizers.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Wellinton, es un abnegado padre y un amoroso esposo dispuesto a sacrificarse diariamente para procurarle bienestar a su pequeña hija a su querida esposa. Con el deseo de adquirir el medicamento necesario para el bienestar de Delia, se esfuerza a diario en sus campos de cultivo y aún más cuando llega la época de cosecha ya que el recojo oportuno de sus productos le garantizan la venta inmediata. Tiene deseos de mejorar su ocupación y productos con mejores herramientas y abonos y fertilizantes naturales.

loans.use: Purchase of tools, manure, fertilizers etc. to improve his production.

loans.name: Tauva

texts.en: Tauva A., 55, is married with 1 child.  She has 3 years of experience in her general store business. She sells to the villagers 7 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Tauva’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She also has a plantation business which helps as a back up to her general store.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es:
Estrella is very hard-working with a wish to improve; she is a mother of 2 children, 10 and 13 years old. Since she was a girl she has raised cattle for a living, obtaining the necessary income; she buys, fattens and sells her cattle at an increased price, this is the routine of her work. She is also an excellent farmer, she grows corn, barley, wheat, and “quinua” and at the harvest season she herself sells her products at the local market. Estrella is a single mother, the only support of her children. On this occasion she requests a loan to be invested in the purchase of a bull.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Estrella es muy trabajadora, con deseos de superación, es madre de 2 niños de 10 y 13 años. Desde niña se dedicó a la crianza de animales, los que le permiten obtener las ganancias que ella necesita, compra, engorda y luego vende su ganado a un mayor precio, esa es su rutina de su trabajo, también es una excelente agricultora, cultiva maíz, cebada, trigo y quinua, cuando sea la época de cosecha ella misma lleva a vender sus productos a la feria local. Estrella es madre soltera, es el único sustento que tiene sus hijos, en esta ocasión solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de un toro.

loans.use: Purchase a bull to increase livestock.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is 32 years old, divorced, and lives with her children: Dennis-8 and Rocio-3. She is a strong and hard working woman. She is dedicated to elaborate handcraft knits at home where she has a knitting machine. Since she separated from her husband, work has been tougher for her because she doesn't count with her partner's support anymore. That is why today she is busy all day knitting clothing pieces like: gloves, caps, bags, crochet purses, and sweaters which in turn she sells at the capital city of Lima. The business is good but very sacrificed. To provide her customers, she has to knit all day. She only rests on Sundays, the only day of the week that she can share with her family full time. Norma wants to see her children live with all the comforts and growing with a good education. With the loan money, she will buy more material to make more clothing pieces so in the future, she can export her goods abroad.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Norma tiene 32 años, es divorciada, vive con sus hijos, Dennis de 8 y Rocio de 3. Es una mujer muy fuerte y trabajadora, se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos artesanales en su casa, donde cuenta con una máquina de tejer.Desde que se separó de su esposo el trabajo se le ha hecho más duro, ya que ya no cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja.Es así, que ahora se ocupa durante todo el día en tejer prendas como guantes, gorros, bolsas, carteras a crochet y chompas, las que vende en la ciudad capital Lima.El negocio es bueno, pero sacrificado, para abastecer a sus clientes debe tejer todo el día, solo descansa los días domingos, día en el cual puede compartir a tiempo completo con su familia. Norma quiere ver a sus pequeños viviendo con todas las comodidades y crecer con una buena educación. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará mayor material para confeccionar más prendas de vestir, para que en el futuro pueda exportar al extranjero.

loans.use: Buying material for making clothing pieces.

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Vusal was born in 1979. He is married and has one child. He has been in this business for 10 years. He lives in Baku city. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy the necessary things for improving his barber shop business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for improving his business

loans.name: Julia Olimpia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 42 años de edad, es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay y vive en la calle 9 MZ. 1 Lote 3, distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. 
Desde hace 1 año viene trabajando en la venta de abarrotes, negocio que está ubicado en su domicilio. Todas las mañanas abre sus puertas para brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Con este préstamo de S/.300, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará productos como 1 saco de arroz, 3 sacos de azúcar, 5 bolsas de golosinas y 2 cajas de atún. Esta inversión le permitirá surtir el negocio.
A pesar de ser madre soltera con un hijo sigue hacia adelante con su negocio y sueña con hacerlo crecer.
texts.en:
Julia is 42 years old and is a member of the Fighting Women of Yungay Community Bank. She lives on 9 MZ Street, Lot 3 in the district and province of Yungay, Ancash. For one year, she has sold groceries. This business is located in her home. Every morning, she opens her doors to offer the best service to her clients. With this loan of 300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy products, including 1 sack of rice, 3 sacks of sugar, 5 bags of sweets, and 2 boxes of tuna. This investment will allow her to supply her business. Despite being a single mother with a son, she continues going forward with her business and dreams of making it grow.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy rice, sugar, bags of sweets, and tuna

loans.name: Azar

texts.en:
Born in 1973, Azar is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the town of Fuzuli in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He is now settled in Absheron region. He is married with two children. 

Four years ago, he started a business transporting goods with his car. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero is 60 years old and she is a widow with 9 children. She sells plantains wholesale and retail to her customers. She started this business in 1992. She needs the loan of N50,000 to purchase more plantains to sell.  She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase plantains to sell

loans.name: Abdurakhmon

texts.ru: Асуев Абдурахмон житель Вахшского района. Живет в одном из самых дальних кишлаков района. Единственная сфера деятельности населения это животноводство. Поэтому и он , имея четверых детей занимается животноводством.Имеет небольшое хозяйство . Планируемый кредит , хочет использовать для того, чтобы закупить материал для ремонта коровника. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdurakhmon A. resides in the Vakhsh region, in one of the region's remotest villages. Animal husbandry is the only way the residents have of making a living. Since Abdurakhmon has four children, he raises livestock and has a small farm. He plans to use the loan he has requested to purchase materials to repair his cowshed. He will repay the loan over the course of 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his cowshed

loans.name: Narcisa Idelsa

texts.es:
La señora Narcisa Idelsa M. D. O., pertenece al Banco comunal Mujeres con Futuro, del distrito D. Mache provincia D. Otuzco, departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
La señora Narcisa tiene una bodega pero se dedica más que todo  a la compra venta D. quesillo  y a la compra D. ganado porcino para venderlo en carne, los animales y el quesillo los consigue en el mismo distrito D. Mache. Embala los quesillos y la carne y los envía para ser  vendidos en los mercados D. Trujillo, debido a que así conseguirá mejores precios.
Otra forma que ella usa para mejorar su negocio es comprando los cerdos pequeños, los cría hasta lograr un tamaño considerable y un peso razonable como para poder ser vendidos en carne. 
Narcisa Idelsa tiene 5 hijos que siempre le ayudaron en su negocio  pero actualmente ya los cinco tienen sus propios compromisos, solamente viven ella y su esposo.
 Con su primer crédito  D. 300 soles que canceló en cuatro cuotas,  implementó su bodega con artículos D. librería.
texts.en:
Narcisa Idelsa M. D. O. belongs to the "Mujeres con Futuro" Communal Bank of the Mache district, province of Otuzco in the department of La Libertad, Perú. Narcisa has a small store but she works more than anything in the buying and selling of cheese and the purchase of pigs to sell their meat. She gets the animals and the cheese in the same district of Mache. She packages the cheeses and the meat and she sends them to be sold in the markets of Trujillo due to the fact that she will obtain better prices. Another thing that she uses to improve her business is buying small pigs and raising them until they achieve a considerable size and a reasonable weight to be able to be sold for their meat. Narcisa Idelsa has 5 children who always help her in her business. But currently the five already have their own commitments and only she and her husband live together. With her first loan of 300 soles that she repaid in four installments she added stationary items to her small store.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more animals to fatten and their sale

loans.name: Caciana

texts.es:
La socia Caciana, vive en la comunidad de Tambo real en el distrito de Zurite de la provincia de Anta, está ubicado a 1 y 40 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco; la socia tiene 48 años de edad, ella tiene 5 hijos de, 30, 27, 20, 15, 13, años.

Nuestra socia y sus 02 hijos mayores quieren iniciar su propio negocio en la venta de lácteos, para lo cuál ella solicita el préstamo para comprar 03 vacas y así juntarlas con las de sus hijos, y hacer una empresa familiar, para que de está manera todos juntos puedan seguir  apoyando a los menores que aún están estudiando.

La socia desea ver a toda su familia trabajando con ella y designándose tareas dentro de la empresa familiar; mejorando su calidad de vida y soñando con un futuro digno y de dicha para cada uno de sus hijos.

Nuestra socia reconoce y valora el esfuerzo de los prestamistas y agradece gentilmente el apoyo brindado y promete la devolución del préstamo en el plazo correspondiente.
texts.en:
Caciana lives in the Tambo Real community in the Zurite district of the Anta province, which is located 1 hour and 40 minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 48 years old and has 5 children who are 30, 27, 20, 15 and 13 years of age. She and her 2 older children want to start their own business selling milk products, for which she is requesting the loan so she can buy 3 cows and add them to her children's cows to thus make a family business. In this way, all of them together can continue to support the young ones who are still studying. She wants to see her whole family working with her and designating tasks within the family business, improving their quality of life and dreaming of a worthy future and happiness for each of her children. She recognizes and values the effort of the lenders. She kindly thanks them for their support and promises to repay the loan in the specified time period.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cows and begin a business to sell milk products.

loans.name: Sien's Group

texts.en:
P. is a leader of a group of borrowers that consists of four members. She is a widow mother of three children: the first one is married and lives separately and the other two are students. She has owned a small fashion shop in front of Angkor Villa hotel since 1996 and she can earn up to $5 per day. She is famous for her down-to-earth skill in designing modern clothes; also, her shop is located in the middle main street.

Lately, she has taken out a loan to renovate her house. The other group members are: T., 42, who owns a small shop selling groceries, is applying the loan to invest in her selling; S., 31, who is a paddy rice trader, is looking for the loan to buy more corn and rice to stock for a while because today is the harvest season; and S., 38, who sells soft drinks to tours, is applying for a loan to buy more products for her shop. They all live in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To renovate a house

loans.name: Bayantsatsral

texts.en:
Bayantsatsral R. lives with his wife and three teenage children in Arhanghay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His children go to local public schools. Bayantsatsral and his wife run a small retail stall for women and men's clothing and shoes at the local market.

Bayantsatsral started the retail business in 2005 by selling clothes and shoes imported from Ereen, China, a border town with Mongolia. While he goes to Ereen to purchase new inventory, his wife manages the stall. Their business capital has increased from 700,000 MNT to 2,000,000 MNT ($1 MNT=1,500 MNT). Bayantsatsral requests a loan to purchase more clothes from Ereen to increase his business inventory. Bayartsatsral and his wife hope to be able to afford university education for all their children.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Ms. Evelyn F. is 49-years of age, married and has been an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People). Her husband is a laborer and she has a food vending business.  In order to generate more income, she is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP for the expansion of her business. She dreams of having retirement savings and wants to build a concrete house someday.

loans.use: To expand a food vending business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell household and basic need goods

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine O. is a 33-year-old mother of three children, ages 14, 10, and 7. All are in school and she is married to a police officer. Christine sells charcoal and sometimes makes dresses. She lives next to Nyamasaria slum near a Coptic church. She purchases the charcoal from trucks (lorries) that come around – bringing it from forests near Masi Mara.

Christine also owns six houses that she rents out. She hopes to use the loan to expand her business by purchasing more charcoal to sell. Her hopes for the future are for her business to enlarge and to sell out of a kiosk and maybe even a truck.

In this video, you can hear me greet Christine saying "Idhi Nade" -- which is Luo for "How are you?" Christine responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "Thank you" and Erokamano, which in Luo, means "thank you." The voices you hear in the background are coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post: http://fellowsblog.kiva.org/2009/05/14/m-banking/

K-MET, the NGO distributing the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development corporation focused on raising health standards in Kenya. To read more about K-MET’s work, please click here: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24

loans.use: Charcoal

loans.name: Union Collana Group

texts.es:
Doña Gloria Gregoria I. César tiene 47 años de edad, casada y con cuatro hijos. Desde hace dos años y cuatro meses viene trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, ocupa el cargo de presidenta en el banco comunal “Unión Collana”, llamado así por el apoyo que tienen entre sí los once integrantes, quienes se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. 
La señora Gloria narra que antes de conocer los beneficios de EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, ella y su esposo contaban como únicos ingresos los productos que le proporcionaba una vaca que le había sido obsequiada por su padre y una pequeña hectárea de cultivo, vendiendo los productos de la cosecha y el queso a los diferentes mercados de Chosica. Gloria queriendo brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, es que tiene la visión de adquirir crédito con el fin de comprar más ganado; así mismo acude a EDAPROSPO–PROSPERIDAD para realizar una de sus grandes metas. Gracias a los esfuerzos de ella, su esposo y al apoyo de nuestra institución se hizo realidad el sueño de darles educación superior a sus cuatro hijos, además de instalar una pequeña tienda. Gloria es una mujer emprendedora que siempre ha logrado sus propósitos, y con éste crédito implementará más su tienda, lo cual obtendrá mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Gloria Gregoria I. César tiene 47 años de edad, casada y con cuatro hijos. Desde hace dos años y cuatro meses viene trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, ocupa el cargo de presidenta en el banco comunal “Unión Collana”, llamado así por el apoyo que tienen entre sí los once integrantes, quienes se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. La señora Gloria narra que antes de conocer los beneficios de EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, ella y su esposo contaban como únicos ingresos los productos que le proporcionaba una vaca que le había sido obsequiada por su padre y una pequeña hectárea de cultivo, vendiendo los productos de la cosecha y el queso a los diferentes mercados de Chosica. Gloria queriendo brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, es que tiene la visión de adquirir crédito con el fin de comprar más ganado; así mismo acude a EDAPROSPO–PROSPERIDAD para realizar una de sus grandes metas. Gracias a los esfuerzos de ella, su esposo y al apoyo de nuestra institución se hizo realidad el sueño de darles educación superior a sus cuatro hijos, además de instalar una pequeña tienda. Gloria es una mujer emprendedora que siempre ha logrado sus propósitos, y con éste crédito implementará más su tienda, lo cual obtendrá mayores ingresos.

Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar insumos

loans.name: Nasreen Muhammad Ashraf Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is the wife of M. A.. They have lived in Lahore, Pakistan, for more than 15 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for Punjabi foods. Nasreen baji is a kind-hearted lady. She tries to give happiness to everyone and her members are very happy with her kind behavior. Her husband is a local master tailor and runs a tailoring center in the community. He has three years of experience in this business. Nasreen baji is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine for her husband so that he is able to sew more clothes and complete orders on time. 

This group loan consists of four additional people:

Rubina baji and Safia baji each want a loan to buy materials (sugar, cooking oil and dry fruits) for their sweetmeats making and selling business.  
Farhat baji wants a loan to buy items (scissors, chairs and a mirror) for her barber shop.  
Sarwar baji wants a loan to buy sanitation supplies (pipes, taps) to resell.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: Nasreen baji is standing on the right side of the photo showing the utensils Rubina baji uses to prepare the sweetmeat.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Marialita

texts.en: Marialita is a proud member of Paglaum MPC. She lives in Pay-ay Diot, Tudela, Misamis Occidental.She is 42, married and has 4 children.  She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store to make a living.  She has been in this business for several years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP per month.  She joined PMPC in 2009 to access loans and hopefully finance her business.  Now, she is requesting her first loan to purchase additional products to sell.  She desires to live comfortably and wants to be able to pay tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: Buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Fidel Simon

texts.es: Don Fidel O. tiene 48 años de edad, casado tiene tres hijos, dos ya son independiente solo tiene a cargo una hija de 12 años, habita en la comarca la gallina en el municipio de Villa del Carmen del departamento de Managua, en casa propia. Los planes para con su familia es mejorar la vivienda y nivel de vida. Trabaja en la Alcaldía de Villa de Carmen desde hace seis meses, como guardia de seguridad, además tiene un terreno en donde esta cultivando. Requiere de financiamiento para realizar mejoras en su vivienda, en la parte de la Cocina comprar materiales de construccion como: cemento, bloque, reprisa otros materiales. Agradece a la Institución por brindarle la oportunidad de un Crédito, logrando cambio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Don Fidel O. is 48 years old, married, and has three children. The two oldest children are financially independent; the one remaining in his care is his 12 year old daughter. His family lives in their own home in the area of La Gallina in the town of Villa del Carmen in the district of Managua. Don Fidel plans to make home improvements in order to improve the living standards for his family.

For the past six months, he has been working as a security guard. He also owns a plot of land that he cultivates. He is requesting a home improvement loan so that he can purchase materials to renovate a kitchen, such as cement, blocks, shelving and other materials. Don Fidel thanks the institution for the opportunity to access a loan so that he can make these changes to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to remodel a kitchen

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen T. is from the village of Maribojoc, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Helen is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Helen is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia believes that hard work and patience are necessary to attain success in life. She manages a sari-sari store (community based store) in her village. Expanding her business is one goal to meet the needs of her family to improve their living conditions. She is married to Rolly, a construction worker. She and her husband work hard to support their children and grand children. The couple is blessed with two children who are married. They happily live in the simple village of Rizal in Santiago City.

Arsenia is glad that she is able to generate a monthly income of PHP10,000 from her store and food vending business. This has been a great help in meeting their daily needs. Arsenia wanted to develop her business and is hoping for a loan from KIVA lenders in the amount of PHP12,000. She aspires to earn more and save for her future and for emergencies.

loans.use: Increase business.

loans.name: Rich

texts.en:
Mr. Rich C., age 29 (pictured with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Vannem Bou, age 26, were married in 2005 and have one son. The family lives along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Rich has been repairing sewing machines for 3 years. His wife has been a hairdresser for 2 months, but she doesn’t have enough materials for her business. So, Rich is asking for a loan of $1,000 so he wife can purchase materials for her beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his wife's beauty salon

loans.name: Bakhshali

texts.en:
Bakhshali N. is 47 years old. He is married and has four children. Since he was very young, he has been in the business of raising and selling cattle, which is why he has a lot of experience. He has been able to succeed thanks to the support provided by AqroInvest Credit Union. He received a loan that he has used to purchase and raise young bulls in their area.

Today, Bakhshali has once again come to AqroInvest Credit Union for a loan to purchase young bulls to raise and sell. It is his biggest dream to improve the conditions of his business in order to then improve the conditions of his family.

loans.use: Purchase four young bulls

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis N. is 43 years old and the husband of Elizabeth Kabura.  They are blessed with four children.  Francis works as a tailor in Shanzu, Mombasa and has been in the business for 9 years.  He rents his workroom on a monthly basis.  Most of his clients are residents of the area where his shop is located.

Francis heard about KADET through an existing client and he is now requesting his first loan, in the amount of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).  He will use the loan to purchase materials like thread and fabric for his tailoring business.  In the future Francis hopes to establish his own shop instead of using the rented space. 

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to the economic empowerment of their clients across Kenya by providing financial services to improve living conditions for the micro-entrepreneurs and their children.  KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya.  You can obtain more information on KADET from their website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase materials like thread and fabric for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, shoes and bags

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 35 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She has a dressmaking and tailoring shop where she sells school uniforms, and suits for men and women. She's been in this business for 20 years and also earns some income from small-scale farming. She says that her business is busy and that she mainly sells to low-income earners. She successfully repaid a previous loan from Faulu for Kes. 20,000 and requested this loan for Kes. 30,000 to buy more material to make clothing. 

She describes herself as dedicated to her business, and through training at Faulu, she has learned to keep proper records so that she can check her losses and increase her profits. In the future, she hopes to have a wholesale business.

loans.use: Add stock of material

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Alfonso G. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito con el cual pudo impermeabilizar el techo de su casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder cambiar el piso al frente y pintar el exterior de la vivienda, ya que está en muy malas condiciones. 
Don Alfonso planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo de su trabajo en una agencia aduanal en el departamento de mensajero, ya que sus hijos le ayudan con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Señor Alfonso G. is very thankful for the cooporation for his previous loan, with which he was able to waterproof the roof of his house. He is seeking a loan to be able to change the front floor and paint the exterior of his home, as it is in a very bad condition. Don Alfonso plans to repay the loan with his wage from his work in a customs agency in the courier department, as his children now help him with the household costs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the front floor and paint the house exterior

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson  vive en la calle  No 5 de la zona  Rosas Pampa de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en alquiler, tiene un  hijo el cual cuida su esposa. 

 Tiene una tienda donde repara celulares de toda marca  y además vende artículos relacionados con celulares y celulares. 

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de repuestos de teléfonos celulares.

Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Wilson lives in #5 Street, in Rosas Pampa, in the city of El Alto. He rents a home with his son who takes care of his wife. He owns a store where he repairs and sells cell phones and related items of all brands. The loan will be used to cell phone spare parts. This is his first loan with IMPRO. His successful evaluation qualified him to get it.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cell phone spare parts

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a 31-year-old entrepreneur from Mombassa, Kenya, who owns and operates a general store that sells foodstuffs and household items. He employs one person at his store, which serves customers from the surrounding rural area. He faces competition from other small retailers in the area and fluctuating demand for his products. Juma will use his loan of 40,000 KES to restock his store with rice, vegetables, wheat flour, sugar and beans.
In the future, Juma would like to move his business to a more spacious location, allowing him to expand. He would also like to renovate his home for himself, his wife, and their three children. He describes himself as hardworking, aggressive, and goal-oriented.

loans.use: To restock his store with rice, vegetables, wheat flour, sugar and beans

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity A. A. is 24 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver and they hope to send their children to good schools. 
Her business is located at Nyalenda in Kisumu. Kisumu is the lake region in Kenya. Fishing and selling fish are common businesses in the region.  Purity also sells fish to the local people. She has been in this business for the past two years and says her major challenge is that there are so many people in the same type of business. Customers are spoilt for choice and are, therefore, not loyal. She is, however, very determined to grow her business and is using her loan to buy more fish. She sees herself supplying in large quantities to the people of Kisumu.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: His Grace Group

texts.en: His Grace Group is a group of five borrowers led by Aloysius C.. He is 56 years old and is married with six children, 4 to 34 years old, with educational levels of kindergarten through college. Aloysius is an AA college degree holder. In the photo, he is the one holding the sign. Aloysius and his family live in the Snapper Hill Community, Carey Street, in Central Monrovia. Aloysius runs his business in the same community. Aloysius’s business is the sale of charcoal used for cooking. He buys wholesale and sells retail to his customers. He has been running this business for more than ten years and started selling with twenty-five bags of charcoal but now operates with about one hundred bags on hand. Aloysius intends to use the money from his share of this group loan as working capital for his business. Aloysius encourages his customers with a good business relationship. He dreams of giving his family a good life. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
For the past 15 years, Tina has sold wine and dry gin in her shop located in the front of her house. Operating this business every day of the week except Sunday, she uses the profits to take care of herself and her children.

Tina is a single parent charged with the responsibility of meeting the needs of her two children in the areas of clothing, shelter, feeding and paying of school fees. She wants to expand her business and hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more dry gin and wine to sell. Tina therefore thanks LAPO microfinance and Kiva for their huge support.

loans.use: To purchase more dry gin and wine to sell.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is 58 years old, married with 6 children. She owns a store where she sells drinks and bottled water at wholesale and retail prices. Her husband sells building materials to support their household. Roseline has been in this business for 31 years. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She hopes to expand her business. She appreciates all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Mery Rossio

texts.es:
La Sra. Mery tiene 39 años de edad y se encuentra casada con el Sr. Edgar con el que tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en la Universidad, su esposo trabaja como empleado en Multivisión(empresa que brinada el servicio de telecable) como técnico instalador. La Sra. Mery tiene como actividad principal sus dos vehiculos que los hace trabajar en la empresa de radio taxi San Luis, del cual recibe una renta semanal, y su segunda actividad es la venta de joyas donde le va muy bien en su negocio, ella conoce sobre la venta de joyas. 
El crédito solicitado por doña Mery está dirigido a su segunda actividad que es la venta de joyas, la misma que lo realiza  de acuerdo a pedido de los clientes, las hace hacer modelos exclusivos y las vende a sus clientes, actualmente tiene un pedido mayor, y el préstamo está dirigido a la compra de anillos, pendientes y pulseras.

Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mery is 39 years old and is married to Mr. Edgar with whom she has 2 children, both in university. Her husband works for Multivisión (a cable television provider company) as an installation technician. Mrs. Mery’s primary source of income is her two vehicles that she rents by the week to the San Luis radio taxi business. Her second source of income, which is going very well, comes from selling jewelry. She knows a lot about selling jewelry. The credit that she is soliciting will be put towards her second business, the jewelry sales which are done by customer request. She makes unique models and sells them to her clients. She currently has a surplus of requests. The loan will be sued to buy rings, pendants and bracelets. She is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust they show in the awarding the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rings, pendants and bracelets.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa Sangaré  est un homme marié de 43ans qui est polygame et qui vit dans le village de N’Tjinina, dans une grande famille traditionnelle  dans la préfecture de  Kolondièba (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Moussa fait l’achat vente de bétails. Il a deux  ans d’expérience dans cette activité. 
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier  prêt individuel.
Il  compte acheter quelques bœufs dans la préfecture de Kolondièba pour aller les revendre à Nièna et Koumantou, au comptant rarement à crédit aux revendeurs et bouchers.   
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel de 50.000FCFA qui  sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
Dans l’avenir Monsieur Sangaré ambitionne aller vendre ses animaux dans les pays voisins tels la Côte- d’Ivoire pour avoir beaucoup plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr Moussa Sangaré is a polygamous married man and 43 years old. He lives in a large traditional family in the village of N'Tjinina in the prefecture of Kolondièba (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Moussa is a cattle trader with a 2-year-long experience. In order to boost his working capital, he joined the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. This is his first individual loan. He will buy a few oxen in the prefecture of Kolondièba and travel to Nièna and Koumantou to sell them for cash and less often for credit to resellers and butchers. Moussa expects to make a monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs, which he will reinvest in his business. His future ambition is to sell his animals in the adjacent countries, such as Côte d'Ivoire, and earn a much higher profit.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald M. is from the village of San Jose. He is 42 years old. Ronald is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ronald raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ronald has been engaged in his business for over 16 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2005, Ronald joined ASKI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronald has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Ronald is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Ronald from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Cecilia Del Rosario

texts.es: La Señora Cecilia Del Rosario tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 1 depende de ella, por lo que no es la primera experiencia que tiene con créditos. Su actividad económica es la de venta de comida hace más de 21 años, ella dio inicio por cuenta propia pues necesitaba mantener una fuente de ingreso necesaria para sufragar los gastos de su hogar. Actualmente ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y comprar materia prima como arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, frutas y verduras. Ella es una persona que se ha sacrificado bastante por lo que sueña que su hija se haga cargo del negocio en un futuro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cecilia Del Rosario has six children, one of whom is still dependant on her, which is one of the reasons why this is not her first experience with microcredit loans. She has sold food for more than 21 years. She began doing so on her own account because she needed a stable income to support her family. Currently, she is requesting a loan for working capital that will buy ingredients like rice, sugar, oil, beans, fruits and vegetables. She has sacrificed a lot to see her dream, that her daughter will take over the business in the future, come true.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food items

loans.name: Farydon Group

texts.en:
Qadseya is a member of the Farydon group, and she lives in the 8th district of Kabul in Afghanistan. She is married and there are seven members in her family. 

She wants to take out a loan for her husband's business. He has a general store and all his family members benefit through the income he generates. He needs the loan to expand his business and to complete his inventory. 

He would like to say that Kiva is an effective process that can support entrepreneurs all around the world.

loans.use: To expand her husband's business

loans.name: Mrs. Chan Noeun Sam Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan Noeun S. is 36 years old and the village bank president. She was selected by its fourteen members who are located in Trapeang Chhuk village in Takeo province. With the loan, the members hope to increase their income to improve their families' standard of livI.. 

Mrs. Chan Noeun S. is a pig breeder and her husband, Mr. Thy Eat, is a construction worker. With both of these positions, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to support her pig breedI. business, Mrs. Chan Noeun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy two more piglets for breedI.. This couple has three children who are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more two piglets for breeding

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un padre de familia de 55 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Pueblo Nuevo, una zona agrícola dedicada principalmente al cultivo de arroz, pertenece a la provincia de Chepén, en la región La Libertad y se encuentra ubicada a una hora y veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la venta de refrescos y papas rellenas (plato típico del Perú, consta de una masa frita de papa sancochada que previamente se ha 'rellenado' de carne, cebolla, huevos y aceitunas), el vende estos alimentos dentro de un kiosko instalado en el colegio de mujeres de la localidad, sus principales alumas son las alumnas y los docentes de esta institución.

Daniel prepara con mucho cuidado los alimentos que vende a las menores de edad, con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad el sostiene a sus familiares. Su negocio ha contado siempre con mucha acogida y el lo ha venido ampliando poco a poco, actualmente ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la adquisición de insumos para aumentar su producción y por ende, sus ventas.

Daniel es un hombre emprendedor y bastante trabajador. Anteriormente ya ha obtenido préstamos de Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Daniel is a 55-year-old father who lives with his family in the Pueblo Nuevo district. It is an agricultural zone dedicated principally to the cultivation of rice. Pueblo Nuevo is in Chepén province, in the La Libertad region, and about an hour and twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For six years, Daniel has worked selling soft drinks and “papas rellenas” [stuffed potatoes]. This is a traditional Peruvian dish consisting of a fried dough of parboiled potatoes which have been “stuffed” with meat, onion, eggs, and olives. He sells these items in a kiosk inside the local girls’ school and his principal customers are the students and teachers of this institution. Daniel takes much care in the preparation of foods that are sold to children. With his earnings, he supports his family. His business has been well received and has grown little by little. Daniel will use this loan for 1000 soles to buy ingredients to increase his production and hence his sales. Daniel is an enterprising and hard-working man. He has had previous loans with Edpyme Alternativa and has always been responsible and punctual in his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jeffrey Hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients and supplies for food business

loans.name: Sulugia

texts.en:
Sulugia S. is 27 years old and married with four children, ages 2 to 8.  She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business.  

Sulugia needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be about $125 per week) to improve her business.

In 2010, Sulugia joined SPBD and this is her 1st loan.   SPBD's loans are Sulugia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD, and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Malakat

texts.ru:
Malakat G. 47 let. Malakat i yeyo semya  yavlayutsya IDP personami ,oni pereselenci iz qoroda Fuzuli seychas oni projivayut v Absheron regione.Vo vremya beqsta iz okkupirovannix territoriy Karabaxa yeyo muj traqicheski poqib i ona ostalas odna s dvuma malenkimi detmi,seychas yeyo deti dochka 19 let uchitsya v universitete i dochka 17 let kotoraya uchitsya v shkole  a tak je zanimayestya tancami. Oni ochen pomoqayut mame po domu i po rabote. 

Malakat uje 5 let zanimayestya etim biznesom prodaji odejdi. Malakat seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye. Ryadom s yeyo maqazinom yest mesto kotoroye ona xotelabi prisoyedenit k svoyemu maqazinu i uvelichit yeqo. Seychas Malakat osobo nujdayetsya v etoy ssude iz za toqo chto yeyo deti uchatsya ona tratit na ix uchebu mnoqo  i poetomu ona nujdayetysa uvelichit pomesheniye i nachat prodovat mnoqo novix raznix tovarov i zarabotat bolshe deneg dlya svoyey semyi.
texts.en:
Malakat G. is 47 years old. Malakat and her family are IDPs (internally displaced people); they relocated from the city of Fuzuli and now live in the Absheron region. During the time of their flight from the occupied Karabaxa territory, her husband tragically died and she was left alone with two small children. Now, her 19-year-old daughter goes to college and her 17-year-old daughter is in school and also practices dance. They help their mama very much around the home and at work. Malakat has been engaged in the business of selling clothes for five years already. Malakat now needs a loan in order to expand her place of business. Near her store, there is a space where she would like to combine with her store and improve it. Now, Malakat especially needs this loan, due to the fact that she is lucky enough to be able to send her children to school, and therefore she needs to expand her place of business and to start offering many new and varied products and earn more money for her family.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her place of business

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mrs. Kong N. (pictured above) and her husband, Mr. Nhaun Kheav, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1983 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. One of their sons is a garment factory worker; the others are in school.
  
Mrs. Kong N. has been selling vegetables and meat for more than six years. She buys these products in Phnom Penh and resells them in the village. Kong has requested Kiva loans several times in the past. She is now requesting another loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to work

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work

loans.name: Damira

texts.en:
Damira O. lives in Orto-Saz village, which is situated in the high-mountain Naryn region. She is 50, married and has three children. One of them is of school-age and the others are grown-up. Damira works as a mailer and enjoys meeting many people and informing her village about the latest developments in the country. Her colleagues characterize her as a very sociable and responsible person. In order to find an additional means of subsistence for her family, Damira started her own business in cattle breeding. Using initial capital of 25,000 KGS to purchase livestock, she worked hard and achieved success. Today, Damira’s farm has three cows, one horse and 20 sheep. All these activities allowed Damira to give a good dowry to her daughter. Now Damira decided to apply for a loan of 35,000 KGS to purchase three calves. With the revenues from the loan, she plans to renovate a barn for her cattle. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Bayanjargal

texts.en: Bayanjargal D. is a widow who lives with her adult aged daughter in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. She and her daughter live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Bayanjargal has been operating a clothes making business with the help of her daughter since 2005 and has built a successful and stable operation. She mostly makes a variety of traditional clothes and boots. After many years of operation, she has not only gained much experience but also developed a large customers base. Her earnings have enabled her to help her son who is living separately on his own. In the future, she is planning to produce more different types of clothes such uniforms. She is a modest and hardworking woman and says, “I want to have my own tailoring factory.” Bayanjargal is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of fabrics, material for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics, material

loans.name: Poni

texts.en: Poni M. is currently in the business of selling charcoal from her home  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Poni is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Wallace Enrique

texts.es: El Sr. Wallace Enrique A. R. él es trabajador activo de la Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como recaudador de fondos tiene  dos años de trabajar para esta institución. Ha tenido  dos  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para gastos de la universidad, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Wallace Enrique A. R. works for the municipal government of San Rafael del Sur as a finance collector.  He has worked for the municipality for two years.  He has taken out two loans through CEPRODEL, and has used each one to buy construction materials to expand and improve his home.  This time, he is requesting a loan for university expenses.  His past CEPRODEL loans have been of great benefit because they allowed him to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: university expenses

loans.name: Nury Elena

texts.es:
Nury Elena F. es una mujer de 41 años que vive en la ciudad de Bogotá, la capital de Colombia, con sus 2 hijos en las edades de 18 y 20 años; ella tiene un restaurante de comida china,   negocio que inició cuando  trabajando  durante mas de 10 años en restaurantes, incluyendo restaurantes chinos, aprendió a preparar comidas,  de ahí nació la idea de crear su propio negocio enfocándose en  comida oriental, así nació el Restaurante Mr.  Shing Express, con el cual lleva  3 años preparando  recetas como arroz chino, cerdo agridulce, arroz de camarones, arroz y pasta con pollo, lumias, y muchas delicias de la cocina oriental, que en la actualidad  registra los siguientes índices financieros: Margen de Utilidad 39.1%,  endeudamiento total 12,59%, autonomía 87.41%, endeudamiento con su nuevo crédito es de un 41,67%, la rotación de Inventarios es  de 5 días y la  rentabilidad sobre  las ventas 16.04%.
Este es el segundo financiamiento otorgado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el anterior  realizo compras de materia prima y  algunos activos para el negocio, su ingresó mejoró ligeramente, ya que pudo hacer una  oferta diversa a sus clientes y lograr mejores ventas que antes, cuando aun no tenia financiamiento. Con su actual credikiva logrará un mejoramiento locativo, cambiando los pisos y la pintura, con el fin de cualificar su imagen, ya que es más agradable para la clientela comer en un lugar que se vea como nuevo y muy higiénico, como el que proyecta mejorar Nury Elena.  Su sueño y gran desafío es comprar su  casa,  para lo cual esta realizando un ahorro en una empresa estatal y con ello también espera abrir otro punto en su propia nueva residencia.
texts.en:
Nury Elena F. is a 41 year old woman who lives in the city of Bogotá, the capital of Colombia. She lives with her 2 children, aged 18 and 20. She has a Chinese food restaurant, a business she began after working for more than 10 years in restaurants, including Chinese restaurants, and learning how to cook. From this, the idea was born to start her own business focusing on Oriental food. Thus the Restaurante Mr. Shing Express was started. She has spent 3 years preparing recipes such as fried rice, sweet and sour pork, shrimp fried rice, chicken with noodles and rice, fish and many delicacies of Oriental cuisine. At this time she has the following financial indexes: profit margin 39.1%,  total debt 12.59%, autonomous 87.41%, the debt with the new loan is 41.67%, the inventory turnover is 5 days and the sales profit is 16.04%.

This is the second loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the previous one, she bought materials and some assets for the business. Her income improved slightly, since she was able to offer different things to her customers and have better sales than before, when she didn't have financing.  With this Kiva loan, she will be able to have improvements on her locale, changing the floors and painting. This will improve her image, since it is nicer for the customers to eat in a place that looks new and sanitary, as Nury Elena is planning. Her dream and challenge is to buy her house, for which she has been saving in a state agency and with it she also hopes to open another locale in her own residence.

loans.use: For locale improvement, changing the floors and painting her Chinese restaurant.

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Digna, ella tiene 79 años y hace varios años quedo viuda, pero de esa relación tuvo 11 hijos, en la actualidad ya todos son mayores de edad, una de sus hijos vive en su casa.

Tiene un kiosco donde vende ceviches y encebollados platos muy apetecidos por los habitantes de la ciudad y del país en sí. Trabaja en la preparación y venta de estos deliciosos platos desde  las 6am hasta las 15h00 o hasta que se termine lo que ella prepara, nos cuenta que tiene muchos que la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos. Su hija le ayuda en su negocio,  también vende gaseosas, aguas, jugos y cervezas.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, yuca, colas, aguas, cervezas y otros productos que se requieren para su negocio. Está en el Banco comunal hace 21 ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que ha recibido en todos estos años que ha estado en el. Su sueño es tener un gran restaurant
texts.en:
The Esperanza y Progreso (Hope and Progress) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the canton of Montecristi, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its craft work, which is recognized nationally and internationally.  It is the home of the famous Panama hats.

This is where Digna lives.  She is 79 years old and has been a widow for many years.  She and her husband had 11 children, who are all now adults.  One of her children lives in her house.

She has a kiosk where she sells ceviche and encebollados (seafood soup), dishes which are enjoyed very much by residents of the city and of Ecuador itself.  She prepares and sells these delicious dishes from 6am until 3pm, or until she runs out of food.  She tells us that she has many customers who prefer her because of the seasoning she uses in her food.  Her daughter helps her in the business.  She also sells soft drinks, water, juices, and beer.

This loan is to buy fish, yucca, soft drinks, water, beer, and other products she needs for her business.  She has been in the communal bank for 21 cycles, and she likes it because of the help she has received all these years she has been part of it.  Her dream is to have a great restaurant.

loans.use: To buy fish, yucca, soft drinks, water, beer, and general provisions.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Héctor, de 32 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Segundina de 28 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Los esfuerzos en cuidado y fertilización que Héctor realiza en sus cultivos, se ven reflejados en la calidad de sus productos, ya que el cacao, café y hojas de coca que cultiva son muy cotizados en el mercado de la ciudad de San Francisco que es donde vende sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras y lo hace con M. alegría, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el transporte es muy escaso por la zona donde tiene sus cultivos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras, para incrementar su producción. Es el noveno crédito con MFP, en sus primeros pagos fue muy puntual y espera poder serlo ahora también, es de los pocos varones de su banco comunal, por lo cual es muy querido por el resto de las socias. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Hector, 32 years old, is a kind and hard-working man who lives in his own home with his wife Segundina, 28 years old, and their two children whom they strive to provide with a better future. The effort Hector has put into tending and fertilizing his crops is reflected in the quality of his products, such as cocoa, coffee and coca leaves, whose cultivation is in great demand in the markets of the city of San Francisco where he sells them.

What he likes most about his work is harvesting his land and he does so with joy.  He has been doing this for 15 years and considers the most difficult aspect to be transporting his products since means of transport are very scarce in the area where his crops are.  In time, he wants to buy more land in order to increase his production.

This is his ninth loan with MFP, in his earlier repayments he was punctual and expects to be able to do the same now.  He is one of the few men in his community bank, which makes him well esteemed to the rest of the members.  With the requested loan of three thousand Peruvian sol he will buy more bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Baasandorj

texts.en:
Baasandorj T., 43, lives with his wife and three sons in the Hovd province of Mongolia. The family live live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in his brother's fence. The older two children attend a local high school and the youngest son is in kindergarten. 

Baasandorj and his wife operate the family business, a car repair service and machinery parts trading business, in their town, out of a rented shipping container. They started this business in 1996 and have since built a stable operation. At first, the couple rented a small stall to sell a variety of machinery parts but after a year of successful business operation, they managed to expand their business by renting a bigger work place, which is the container. Their earnings have enabled them to buy a plot of land and they hope to one day move to this land, after building a fence and connecting power.

For the future, Baasandorj plans to expand his car repair service. He is a hardworking man and is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to renovate his old tools and equipment for his car repair service and purchase more machinery parts from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, to sell at his container.

loans.use: To renovate his old tools and equipment and purchase more machinery parts.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. is a married woman with two children. Gladys was educated through the middle school. Her husband is a farmer.

For the past four years, to earn a living, Gladys has been selling provisions at a roadside wooden stand at Abrafo near Abura. With her business income she is able to pay for her family's daily living expenses. For example, she uses her income to purchase groceries, pay electricity bills, and cover her children's school fees. She explains that she is very proud to be able to contribute to their household income so that they have a decent standard of living.
