She is now seeking a loan in the amount of $275 to buy inventory for her shop in order to meet customer demand. She plans on using the additional profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan to offer her customers a larger variety of goods and to thereby attract more customers. In this way, she hopes to invest most of the profits generated by the loan back into her business.

loans.use: To satisfy customer demand and to attract more customers by increasing her inventory

loans.name: Michael Wacira

texts.en:
Since 2004, Michael has been running a clinical laboratory in Nairobi town centre. He earns a profit of 25,500 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month. He is 36 years old, married to Gilian Wambui and they have two children. He describes himself as hardworking. 

Michael was introduced to KADET by an old member, and he is applying for a second loan of 50,000 KES. He plans to use the entire amount to buy one microscope which will help him serve his customers well. He plans to plough the anticipated profit back into the business. In the future he hopes to open a hospital.

loans.use: To buy a microscope

loans.name: Tiacaque Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Tiacaque, este nombre fue elegido porque las señoras viven en la comunidad de  Tiacaque que significa: lugar donde nace agua entre peñascos. Está ubicado en ixtlahuaca, México y se caracteriza por tener una presa de agua y que la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la crianza de borregos. El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes y es la segunda vez que solicitan un crédito. Una de las integrantes del grupo se llama Rosario A. C. Tiene 33 años y estudió hasta la secundaria, es ama de casa y comerciante, comenta que su negocio es muy importante ya que contribuye con los gastos de su familia, ella tiene dos hijos varones y una hija. Rosario se dedica a la crianza de borregos desde hace 3 años, ella pide el prestamos para fortalecer su negocio. Su dedicación ha permitido que sus animales sean reconocidos por los clientes ya que la carne es de buena calidad. El crédito le ayudará a comprar más alimento para sus borregos. Ella sueña que algún día pueda incrementar el número de sus animales y así ofrecerles a sus hijos una carrera profesional. Observaciones, la persona que no se ve bien se llama María Cristina.
texts.en:
This group is called Tiacaque, and the name was chosen because the women live in the community of Tiacaque which means: the place where the water  comes forth between the crags. It is located in Ixtlahuaca, México and is characterized by having a dam. The majority of the inhabitants raise lambs. 

The group is made up of twelve memebers and it is the second time they are requesting a loan. One of the members of the group is called Rosario A. C. She is 33 years old and has an eighth grade education. She is a housewife and merchant. She says that her business is very important because it contributes to her family's expenses. She has two sons and one daughter. Rosario has been raising lambs for three years and is requesting the loan to strengthen her business. Her dedication has allowed her to be recognized by her customers for having high quality meat. The loan will help her buy food for the animals. She dreams of one day being able to increase the number of animals she has and in this way offer her children a professional career.

*Note: The person that cannot be seen very well in the photo is called María Cristina.

loans.use: Raising lambs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying additional inventory of used clothing

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida has been living in Sahiwal for past 15 years with her family in a 2 room brick house.  Sahiwal is a small city of Pakistan that is known for its agriculture and cattle farming.  She is 41 years of age and has given birth to 6 children.  All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education except the youngest daughter who is only 1 year old and a son who is 5 years old. 

Her husband’s name is M. S. and he is a farmer by profession.  He owns a little piece of land where he grows different seasonal crops.  He then cultivates them and sells to different shops and people for profit.  His land is very fertile and he gets good crops from it every year. 

Abida is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities.  She is a very active lady and is raising her children with great care. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business.  By utilizing the loan money he will buy fertilizers and seeds to grow even better crops and make more profits. 

She is very hopeful that her husband will be able to get maximum results from his agriculture business after making a loan investment into it. 
She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.  She is hopeful that it will result in improving the financial condition for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for the family farm.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: This is 31-year-old Aminata T..  She is married and has 3 children aged 7, 9, and 13 who live with her. She helps her husband to support the family.  In 2006, Aminata T. established her ready-made items business. She began her business to educate her children, buy land and help in the upkeep of the home. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 250,000 every month. She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000 to buy more stock. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000 . In the future, Aminata plans to buy larger volumes to supply to other traders  and to travel to neighboring Guinea for more profit. She is very determined. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to add more items to stock

loans.name: Pio

texts.en:
Pio A. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 52 years old. Pio is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Pio owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Pio has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP per harvest, or every five months, for these activities.

In 2011, Pio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pio is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Pio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 23 years old and single. He sometimes takes temporary jobs such as washing clothes, cleaning a compound, etc. to earn a living. He has been working this way for 5 years. He also sells phone accessories and kitchen utensils. 

With the loan, he will buy more phone accessories, kitchen foil, etc. to sale. He hopes to buy a house with the profits that he hopes to make.

loans.use: To buy phone accessories and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna and her husband, Mr. Sam, both pictured above, have been married since 2005. Mr. Sam is a fisherman and also raises ducks at home. The couple has two young sons who are in school. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Vanna is a tailor and assists her husband in his duck-raising business. She asked for a Kiva loan to purchase additional ducks for her husband to raise. She hopes to buy more and keep increasing their flock, hence her request for another loan of US$ 600. Vanna was able to successfully repay a previous loan on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional ducks for her husband to raise

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira is 42 years old and married with two children. Both of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Her husband is a cobbler by profession and involved in making shoes. He makes contracts with different shoe-selling companies and provides the finished goods to them on order. Tahira herself is a very caring lady. She manages her household activities by staying at home.  

Tahira has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With this loan, he will buy raw materials such as leather, shoe laces, nails and glue for making shoes in larger quantity and fulfilling his orders. He has been operating this business for the past six years, and Tahira is hopeful that an investment will be productive for his business and earn him better profits. 

Tahira is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She is confident about her family’s better financial future. 
In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Tahira.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for a shoe-making business.

loans.name: Niassya Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été créé le 17 mai 2011. Il est composé de 42 femmes qui habitent ensemble et se sont regroupées par des liens d'affinité. Leurs activités portent sur le petit commerce, le maraichage et la riziculture.

Madame Marie Noëlle Victoire qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est célibataire mère de deux enfants en sa charge. 

Elle s'active dans le petit commerce de balaie et de jus de citron depuis plus de deux ans. 

Ce prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son activité qui est en plein extension.

Les bénéfices qu'elle va gagner lui permettront d'assurer la scolarité et la nourriture de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" (loan group) was created on May 17, 2011. The group is composed of 42 women who live together and came together in the group because of similar tastes.  Their businesses involve buying and selling small items, growing vegetables for sale, and growing rice. 

Madame Marie Noëlle Victoire who is on the right in the photo, raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 38, single, and the mother of two children for whom she is responsible. 

She has had a small-scale business selling brooms and lemon juice for two years. This loan will allow her to better develop her business which is currently expanding. The profit she will make will allow her to pay school fees and food expenditures for her children.

loans.use: to buy brooms and lemon juice.

loans.name: Lannaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Lannaya a été crée le 27 Mai 2007. Il est composé de 16 femmes toutes habitant la même localité. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce. 

Debout à droite de la photo, Marietou est la responsable du groupe. Elle âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. 

Elle vend des arachides en graines au niveau du marché hebdomadaire de leur localité, activité qu'elle a mené depuis plusieurs années. 

Ce prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante en cette période et de revendre à un bon prix pendant l'hivernage où la matière sera prisée. 

Avec les recettes générées, elle compte renforcer son épargne, et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa progéniture (dans les domaines: scolarité, sanitaire, alimentaire)
texts.en:
The Lannaya solidarity group has been created on May 27, 2007. It is composed of 16 women living in the same village. Their main business acvitiviy is retail.

Marieto, standing on the right in the photo, is the grop’s leader. She is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of 10.

She sells peanuts (ground nuts) and  seeds at the weekly market of their village, something she has been doing for years.

This loan will allow her to buy a sufficient quality of produce now to resell it at a good price later during the winter season, when gains in value.

With the income from this business, she would like to grow her savings and improve the life conditions of her children (schooling, health and hygiene, food).

loans.use: to purchase peanut seeds or peanuts in the shell

loans.name: Juan Sergio

texts.es:
El  señor Juan Sergio  vive en la ciudad de Managua
Es padre  de familia trabaja en una empresa ubicada en la ciudad de Managua laborando como  promotor desde dos año
 Don Juan Sergio  visito nuestra instalación para solicitar un crédito  ya que necesitaba el crédito para invertir en una mejora para su vivienda y así darle a su familia una condición segura.
La inversión del crédito los va a utilizar para la compra de cemento, arena, bloque, y pago de mano de obra. Ya que con ese material va a poder hacer un anexo a la  vivienda.
texts.en: Juan Sergio lives in the city of Managua.  He’s a father and has worked as a Salesman in a private firm for the last two years.  Juan Sergio visited our installation to request a loan because he needed the loan to invest in home improvements to provide his family with safe conditions.  He will use the loan to buy cement, sand, concrete block and to pay labor costs because he’s going to use this material to add on to his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Ana Elsa

texts.es:
Ana, tiene una hija de 20 años de edad, administran una tienda de productos de uso domestico, este negocio tiene 10 años de existir, Ana lo heredo de sus padres, actualmente le provee los necesario para el hogar y mantiene un buen número de clientes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como: azúcar, aceite, sal, arroz, frijol, esta compra será una gran ayuda para el negocio y para Ana, pues ofrecerá un mayor variedad de productos, atendiendo la demanda.
Su objetivo es tener el negocio surtido de mercadería, ya que esto le ocasionara un aumento a las ventas y atraerá a nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Ana has a 20-year-old daughter, and they run a store that sells products for home use. This business is ten years old. Ana inherited it from her parents, and currently she stocks items needed in homes and has a good number of customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise like: sugar, oil, salt, rice and beans. This purchase will be a great help for the business and for Ana because she will offer a greater variety of products, responding to demand.

Her goal is to have her business stocked with merchandise because this will lead to an increase in sales and will attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy products: sugar, oil, salt, rice and beans for her business.

loans.name: Bento

texts.pt:
Nasceu em xai-xai, distrito de xai-xai,provincia de gaza, tem 30 anos, masculino, tem nivel medio de escolarização, solteiro vive maritalmente tem residencia fixa na cidade de maputo onde se encontra a familia , tem 3 filhos, 2 raparigas e 1 rapaz,a  de  7 anos encontra se a estudar,os outros tem 4anos e 2anos . nao tem outras pessoas a sua responsabilidade .
  Reside  em bela- vista onde se encontra a trabalhar na administracao do distrito de matutuine,é  tecnico profissional de administracao publica na area de recursos humanos, tem salario de  7.470,00mt, com salario sustenta a familia e faz poupança.
Nunca teve emprestimo noutro banco, conheceu a hluvuku agora que esta aqui no distrito este é o primeiro emprestimo de  5.000,00mt para vedação do terreno no sector de habitação. tem sonho de construir um centro social para os funcionarios da administracao e o desafio sera falta de bens de garantia que possam cubrir o montante que vai solicitar porque o projecto sera de grande dimensão.
texts.en:
Bento was born in Xai-Xai, in the Xai-Xai district, Gaza province.  He is 30 years old and has some post secondary school education.  He is unmarried but lives with his partner in the city of Maputo with their family.  He has 3 children, 2 girls and a boy.  The eldest is 7 and attends school.  The other children are ages 4 and 2. He does not support anyone else.

He lives in Bela-Vista where he works in the local goverment of the district of Matutuine.  He is a technical professional of public administration working in Human Resources.  He earns a salary of 7.470,00mt per month and is able to support his family and save money.

He has never had a loan with another bank.  He learned about Hluvuku once he came to this district.  This is his first loan, in the amount of 5.000,00mt to be used to fence the property around his home.  His dream is to build a community center for people who work in the local government.  The challenge will be the lack of property to use as collateral for the amount of money he would request because it would be a large-scale project.

loans.use: to fence the land around his home.

loans.name: Erkingul's Group

texts.en:
Erkingul is the leader of this group. She is 51, and married to a construction worker who works in Russia. Each month he transfers his family about 7000 Soms (KGS). Erkingul has raised three sons and a daughter; the sons work in construction with their dad. Erkingul is a retiree, but she is an active person. She cultivates agricultural products, and breeds livestock for making additional money. She started this activity six years ago with an initial investment of 4000 Soms (KGS). Selling some part of the harvest, and reselling livestock after fattening, Erkingul earns an additional 3000 Soms (KGS) per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase sheep to increase the number of livestock. In the future, Erkingul plans to celebrate her grandson’s birth.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Charle

texts.en: Charle is a hardworking 37-year-old businessman. He is married. For the last three years, he has been selling curtains and bed sheets to make a living. Previously he used to sell clothes. He wants in the next five years to be operating on wholesale terms. His dream is to be importing curtains and bed sheets to sell locally. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy curtains and bed sheets. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now able to access a credit facility easily.

loans.use: to buy curtains and bed sheets

loans.name: Rahimchon

texts.ru:
Рахимчон целеустремлённый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и отец 3 детей. Он старается, чтоб его дети выросли образованными и хорошими людьми, и чтоб работали в хороших кампаниях и открыли свой собственный бизнес. Рахимчон занимается ремонтам и продажей автомобилей. Он покупает автомобилей из первых рук, а затем продает на выгодную цену. Он отремонтирует и красит сам, который позволить ему уменьшать расходы для ремонта автомобиля. Ему помогает его братья. Он начинал свой бизнес год назад с мелкого ремонта машин и в настоящее время владеет частном мастерском на местном городе. Рахимчон хотел бы получит займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки автомобиля.  Он заранее благодарит всех, кто поддерживает его. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Rahimchon is a goal-oriented and conscientious person.  He is married and is a father of three children.  He tries to ensure that his children grow up to become educated and good people, and that they could work in good companies and opened their own businesses.  Rahimchon is involved in repairing and selling cars.  He buys cars first-hand and then sells them at a more profitable price.  He repairs and paints cars himself, and this allows him to reduce car repair expenses.  His brothers help him.  He started his business one year ago with small car repairs and now owns a private repair shop in the local town.  Rahimchon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of a car.  He thanks everyone who supports him in advance.

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en: Kevin is a 32-year-old farmer who is married to Agusti, a 29-year-old lady. They are blessed with three children, namely: Julfan, 7, is attending the first grade of elementary school; Yuyun, 5, is attending kindergarten and Radit, 4. Kevin was born into a farming family. He is known as a hard worker. He cultivates corn and kangkung (water spinach), as well as [having a] paddy at the farm. According to Kevin, the income generated from the harvest is unstable due to weather changes. Kevin was thinking of cultivating various vegetables on his farm, such as tomatoes, onions, mustard greens and spinach. Recently he got information from his neighbor about the Individual Lending Program provided by TLM for small farmers like him. He got interested in joining the program and applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Indonesian rupiah. He would like to buy seeds, manure, and pesticides to protect the plants from disease. He is hoping that TLM will approve his application soon.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure and pesticides

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Elizabeth has a shop that sells coconuts & bananas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy coconuts & bananas for sale.

Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  buy pigs for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Mahukpego 2 Group

texts.fr: MAHUKPEGO 2 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Bricia (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans. Bricia est mariée à un certain Samson et a deux enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un à leur charge. Bricia  vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant à charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Bricia a arrêté l’école au cours primaire.  Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Bricia vend depuis une six ans, des chaussures et des glacières par le système de distribution. Bricia s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité, Bricia sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKPEGO 2. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
"MAHUKPEGO 2" is a group composed of three persons whose members reside in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, Bricia (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 36 years old and married to a man named Samson. They have two children, both in school. One of the children is still in their care. The couple jointly ensures that the various household expenses are covered. 

Bricia dropped out of elementary school. To cope with her expenses, she has been selling footwear and insulated containers (coolers) for six years via the distribution system. She gets her supplies from Benin and from Nigeria. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers, and with the aim of increasing her working capital and bolstering her business, Bricia as well as the other members of the group MAHUKPEGO 2 are requesting a third loan from ALIDé. This loan will serve them in responding better to the demands of their customers and in making more profit.

loans.use: to buy coolers and shoes

loans.name: Katlyn

texts.en:
This is Katlyn, 28, resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is a single mother with one child. By the grace of God, she has managed to support her child’s schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her child all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Katlyn, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Katlyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal in the local neighbourhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos' worth of cooking oil or an egg. She makes a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Katlyn hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving her child a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Âgée de 31 ans, Madame Mariam est mariée et mère de trois. Elle vit avec son époux à Médine- Sikasso.
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, elle s’est initiée depuis plus de deux ans à cette activité de vente d’oignons au nouveau  marché de Médine dont elle dispose d’une  table où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux année. Elle est à son quatrième crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter 20 sacs d’oignons (10 sacs de petites graines et 10 sacs de grosses graines) auprès d’une femme qui lui vend en gros au comptant et à crédit.
 Ses marchandises sont vendues au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Avec ce quatrième crédit elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt .
texts.en:
Ms. Mariam, 31 years old, is a married mother of three children. She lives with her husband in Médine-Sikasso. After having run several businesses without success, she has for over two years become familiar with this business of selling onions at the new market in Médine, where she has a table. There, she is much in demand by her customers for the quality of her products. 

To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, Ms. Mariam decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two year ago. She is on her fourth loan, which will enable her to increase her business capital in order to buy 20 sacks of onions (10 sacks of small and 10 sacks of large) from a woman who sells in bulk and accepts cash or credit. Ms. Mariam sells her merchandise retail, for cash or on credit, to a customer base composed essentially of women. 

With this fourth loan, Ms. Mariam envisions making an average monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her business capital, to help with family expenses, and to cover the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Jalal is a 24-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and two siblings. His father is the main source of income in the family, and he’s doing the best he can to cover their expenses and fulfill their needs. For this reason, Jalal started to work at an early age in order to help his father. So he opened his own fruits and vegetables shop in 2008 and continues to further grow it. 

Today, he’s looking to borrow $500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a weighing machine to be able to enhance his control over his products. In the future, he plans to deliver some of his goods to the neighboring areas.

loans.use: to purchase a weighing machine.

loans.name: Enkhbayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhbayar, 32, is a taxi driver. She has been running her business since 2008 around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has already gained enough experience to do her business in the future. She lives with her two sons and her husband in her brother’s house. 

She recently started a new business, a textiles shop, with her sister in a rental apartment. The preparation is going well, but some sewing tools and raw materials are needed to start her job completely. She needed exactly MNT 3,970,000 to purchase them. Therefore Enkhbayar is taking a loan to purchase some textile materials and a sewing machine, and other tools to start her new business.

loans.use: To purchase some textile materials and a sewing machine and other tools to start her new business.

loans.name: Dim-Dim Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Dim-Dim” group from Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are small businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL for each member in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profits, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Kadiatu. Kadiatu was born in Lunsar about thirty-six years ago. She is married to a teacher and the couple has two children who are attending primary school. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman for five years now. She sells food at the market. She has requested this loan in order to buy palm oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, rice, and other items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, rice, and other items in bulk

loans.name: María Edilma

texts.es: A sus 63 años, la señora Maria Edilma se dedica desde su propia casa a la confección de prendas de vestir sobre medida y arreglos de modistería. Esta labor la realiza desde hace 20 años y le ha permitido desde entonces generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de sus 5 hijos, su madre y un hermano. Con el ánimo de confeccionar productos de lencería hogar para ofrecer a sus clientes y poder mejorar sus ventas, la señora Maria Edilma necesita de la compra de insumos tales como telas, hilos y moldes que le permitan producir su línea hogar y así tener los recursos necesarios para cuidar a su madre y hermano quienes se encuentran delicados de salud y cumplir su sueño de tener un cultivo de frutas y animales para la venta.
texts.en:
At her 63 years of age Maria Edilma makes made-to-order clothing and does alterations from her own house.  She has been doing this work for 20 years, and it has allowed her to generate the needed income to support her five children, her mother, and a brother.

In order to make household linen products to offer to her customers, and to be able to improve her sales, Maria Edilama needs to buy supplies like fabric, needles, and patterns.  These supplies will allow her to produce her line of household linens.  That way she will have the resources needed to take care of her mother and brother, who are in delicate health.  She will also be able to fulfill her dream of having fruit crops and animals to sell.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fabric, needles, and patterns.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Marina;  La socia continua con su negocio de atención y administracion de su restaurante, la socia desea seguir prosperando y para ello se esfuerza todos los dias para crecer economicamnete y dar una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos, la socia desea en esta ocasión invertir el prestamo en la compra de insumos para la cocina, la socia comprara arros, aceite, otros insumos al por mayor.
texts.en: The member is Marina; She continues with her business of personal care and administration of her restaurant. She wishes to continue to prosper and for that she strives everyday to grow economically and give a good quality of life to her children. On this occasion, she wishes to invest her loan in the purchase of supplies for the kitchen. She will buy rice, oil, and other supplies wholesale.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and other supplies wholesale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys has been in farming for six years, with her farm producing milk and then selling it to Kenya Co-operative Creameries. She also runs a retail business dealing with maize sold mainly to secondary schools within the local market. She is married with one child who is aged 10 years and in school.

Gladys has requested a loan of 43,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will provide milk for the family's daily consumption. She is optimistic the farming business will continue to grow and give her family a better living standard.

Gladys is, however, grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Gurubari

texts.en:
Gurubari, a 39 year old woman from a village of Koraput district, Odisha is a an agricultural laborer and a successful micro-entrepreneur. She toils hard in the fields to earn a minimal daily-wage income. She concurrently runs her animal husbandry business which allows her to utilize the the little time she has left after her full-time work.

With a household size of 6, her family struggles to meet the expenses, let alone save some money for the future. They earn a monthly income of 4,000 INR, out of which 3,000 goes out as expenses. This means savings of 1,000, if they don't have any unexpected expenses for the month. Gurubari is not a woman who would sit back and accept the circumstances. She doesn't want to leave a stone upturned to ensure that her family is headed towards a reliable future. She wants to expand her business by buying a cow. She expects to increase her monthly income by 2,000 INR with this investment. She seeks a loan of 35,000 INR to buy a buffalo. She hopes to repay the amount in 24 monthly installments.

loans.use: to buy a cow for milking

loans.name: Ldyia

texts.en: Ldyia is married with two children. She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a retail shop . She works in her shop seven days a week . Her major business challenges include high transportation costs.  She has applied for a loan  from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, flour, boxes of soap, cooking oil, beans, and rice. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent,food, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, flour, boxes of soap

loans.name: Flor Del Roció

texts.en:
Flor del Rocio has a general store where she sells many different products. Her husband was the main reason she started the business as he provided the inspiration and the start up capital. She started with only $30 worth of products in stock but she has been growing progressively. Her husband also sells the chemical products he makes (mostly for cleaning) at their store. They have had to put railings around their home because there have been several robber attempts targeted at their business

Flor needs the loan so she can invest in toys for the upcoming Christmas season. She has had many clients approach her asking for these types of goods. She has 3 kids and is happily married.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in products to sell for the holiday season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to expand and diversify my business

loans.name: Zumrud

texts.en:
This 52-year-old mother of 4 children is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Khodjali. She lives with her family in the  Khirdalan settlement. 
She took out a first loan of $400 to buy clothes to sell in the settlement.
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to build a shop.
She has 11 years of experience in this business.

loans.use: To build a shop

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: Nine years ago, Tatyana opened a small footwear kiosk at one of the local markets in Melitopol, Ukraine. Married and a mother of two children, Tatyana hoped to increase her family’s standard of living and provide stable financial support to her children. During the past nine years, Tatyana has proven herself as a successful and hard-working entrepreneur. She is also a source of counsel and advice for new entrepreneurs in the market and is known widely for her decisive and determined nature. A veteran client of Nadezhda Ukraine, Tatyana has used her past loans wisely to expand her business, and has established a perfect credit history. Currently, Tatyana is seeking a loan of $500 to purchase more inventory. With the increased profits, Tatyana hopes to further expand her business and, eventually, assist her daughter in purchasing an apartment.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Seia

texts.en: Seia A. is 55 years old, and has eleven children. Her burdens have now become slightly ligher as some of her children are overseas, and some have started their own families. However, she still needs money to support her own needs and her domestic commitments. She chose cooking pancakes as her business as she can make them with ease. She has spent her first loan of $300 to purchase the materials necessary to start her business. She has used the profits of her business to pay for the education of her youngest daughter’s school fees. She is extremely appreciative of the help she has received thus far.

loans.use: Buying ingredients for the pancakes business.

loans.name: Elvia Domitila

texts.es:
Elvia is 54 years old and lives in Licapa, in the district of Paiján, Province of Ascope, in the department of La Libertad. She has 6 children, two of whom still live with her. The rest of her children are adults and they help her cover some of her expenses. Elvia studied until 9th graD..

Elvia has sold beauty products for a long time and with the earnings that were left she would, little by little, buy merchandise like adult clothing and undergarments, etc. She now has a stall at the AAHH José Carlos Mariátegui-Licapa market. In addition, she delivers her merchandise to some of her neighbors and friends and charges them weekly. She also sells natural medicine.

She heard about Manuela Ramos from the governor of Paiján. She formed the Communal Bank “Manos Unidas” and obtained her first loan of 300 soles (approximately $100). With this money she traveled to Lima and bought merchandise at a better price than in Trujillo (plastics, comforters and also clothing), products that she brought to sell in different parts of the Ascope province.

With this loan of 1,700 soles (approximately $567) from Manuela Ramos, which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy women’s and children’s clothing, and she will use another part of the loan to change the door of the stall where she sells her merchandise, to make it safer.

Elvia was president of the Mothers of Licapa Club for 10 years, and now is president of the Communal Bank “Manos Unidas.” Her greatest dream is to buy another stall in order to start another business selling groceries, and to have a truck to sell all types of tubers and vegetables in different markets in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elvia tiene 54 años D. edad, actualmente vive en Licapa, distrito D. Paiján, Provincia D. Ascope del Departamento D. La Libertad; tiene 6 hijos, 2 dependen D. ella, los demás ya son mayores y le ayudan a cubrir algunos gastos. La señora Elvia estudió hasta el tercer año D. secundaria.

Hace mucho tiempo que se dedicaba a la venta D. productos D. belleza y con las ganancias que le dejaba fue comprando poco a poco mercadería como ropa D. adulto, ropa interior, etc. Actualemnte tiene un puesto en el mercado del AA.HH José Carlos Mariátegui- Licapa, a su vez reparte su mercadería a algunas vecinas y amistades para cobrar semanalmente, también venD. medicina natural.

Se enteró D. la existencia D. Manuela Ramos por medio D. la Gobernadora D. Paiján; formó el Banco Comunal Manos Unidas y obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/.300 ($ 100 aprox.), con este dinero viajó a Lima y compró a mercadería a mejor precio que en Trujillo (plásticos, edredones, y también ropa) productos que llevó a vender por diferentes lugares D. la provincia D. Ascope.

Con el reciente préstamo obtenido D. Manuela ramos D. S/. 1,700.00 ($ 567 aprox.) el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará ropa D. dama y niños, y otra parte del préstamo lo utilizará para cambiar la puerta del puesto donD. venD. y hacerlo más seguro.

La señora Elvia fue presidenta del club D. madres D. Licapa por 10 años actualmente es presidenta D. su Banco Comunal Manos Unidas. Su mayor sueño es comprar otro puesto para tener el negocio D. venta D. abarrotes y una camioneta para vender todo tipo D. tubérculos y verduras en las diferentes ferias D. la zona.

loans.use: Buy women's and children's clothing; infrastructure (change the door of her store).

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Mrs. POV Nan (aged 52) got married in 1979 and has six children: three sons and three daughters. She runs a business weaving silk at home. In fact, she learned to weave silk from her mother in 1968 and began her silk production in that year. However, during the years of rule by the Khmer Rouge regime, she did not weave. She restarted her silk production in 1979, the year she got married. Her husband is a mechanic who repairs machines.

Mrs Pov is requesting a MAXIMA loan, her first, for $300 She will use this money to expand her silk production by purchasing silk materials, sewing thread and covering fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread and  pay for fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en: Yusufu is 20 years old and married with a child.  He sells lubricants and with his previous loans, has purchased local products such as palm oil, which he sells to the market women of Magburaka town in Sierra Leone. With the profits from his sales business, Yusufu is now capable of taking good care of his family by providing for their basic needs and other expenses. He is very determined to expand his business by purchasing fuel and lubricants wholesale.  Yusufu is requesting a $350 loan with to expand his business as planned.

loans.use: To diversify his business by starting to offer fuel and lubricants at his general store.

loans.name: Nabweru North D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is NaN. Florence. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to increase her stock of charcoal. NaN. is 33 years old and is married. She has 3 children ranging from age 2 to 5, all of whom go to school. Each week, NaN. makes approximately UGX 60,000 in profit and combined with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a permanent charcoal stall.

NaN. is joined in her small group by Ruth N., Sharifah N., Margret N., and Lilian N.. Ruth N. is currently in the business of running a salon and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to open up another salon.

Sharifah N. is currently in the business of selling soft drinks and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to buy a fridge.

Margret N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 120,000 to add to her business.

Lilian N. is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to expand her charcoal business.

loans.use: To expand a charcoal business

loans.name: Marieta Nzisa

texts.en:
Description
Marietta Nzisa is 30 years old. She’s married with one child and is expecting her second in February.  Marietta started her business in the year 2006 after finishing her computer course, in one of computer colleges in the city, she then approached her mother with a request of a loan to start her own business since she did not like to be asking her mother for money to buy things like creams, sanitary towels etc.  Her mother loaned her Ksh 80,000, and with this she bought three computers and rented a stall at Kasarani a town on the outskirts of Nairobi, providing internet and photocopying services.

Due to the popularity and demand of computer services, Marietta wants to add three more computers so as to cope with her growing number of customers.  Currently her loyal customers must wait 30 minutes to get access to one computer.  The wait sometimes makes some customers leave, and this pains Marietta greatly.  She is therefore requesting a loan amounting to Ksh 85,000. Given this loan Marietta will be able to purchase the three brand new computers, a landmark for Marietta since she will be able to provide quick and efficient service.  She will also be training at least one student who wants to be trained in a computer course so that that instead of going all the way to town they will save by training at her place.

Marietta thanks the Kiva lenders in advance.  The repayment period for this loan is 10-12 months.

loans.use: Purchase  Three Computers.

loans.name: Manuel Roman

texts.es:
For more than 15 years, Manuel Arévalo has operated his small business in central America. He buys bulks of clothing and sell them to this family a good prices. This business became familial since his family members all work in the business. In addition to his children, he has other employees during the weekends.

He seeks a loan of $850 which will be repaid in 6 months. The loan will be used to invest in summer apparel and to upgrade the store so it will be ready to be stocked with new styles. With your help, this family will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Manuel Arévalo tiene mas de 15 años de tener su pequeño local en un centro comercia, el compra pacas de ropa para toda la familia y las vende a buenos precios este negocio se volvió familiar debido a que todos trabajan en el negocio. Además sus hijos tienen otros empleos los fines de semana para ayudar.

El solicita un crédito por US $ 850 que esta dispuesto a pagar en 6 meses para invertir en ropa para el verano y acondicionar el local. Tener surtido el negocio para la nueva temporada. Con tu ayuda esta familia podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura Raquel F. Ramirez (25) is the single mother of a 2-year-old boy.

Laura is an entrepreneur who has the ability to spot business opportunities. In Paraguay is like a tradition for men to play soccer in the evening. After the game, they usually drink some beers and eat. Thinking about this fact, Laura decided to open a mini-restaurant where she sells hamburgers and different types of drinks. The restaurant is opened from 5 pm to midnight. Laura employs two poor women from her neighborhood to help her in serving the customers.

The money provided by the loan will be invested in the purchase of products such as drinks and ingredients to prepare the hamburgers for Laura’s mini-restaurant.

loans.use: Purchase of drinks and ingredients to prepare hamburgers

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana belongs to the “Unión II” comunal bank.

Maximiliana is married. She is 40 years old and has 3 children. She and her husband have a store where they sell computers and accessories. The store space is rented and is located on a well-situated street in Ayacucho. They have had this business for 3 years and little by little they are improving it. They now have employees with technical training.

Maximiliana needs a loan of 2,500.00 soles, which she will invest in buying computer accessories, such as surge protectors, back-up batteries, and printer inks.

Maximiliana’s dreams are to buy a house in the center of the city, to own her own store space, and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Maximiliana pertenece al Banco Comunal Unión II.

Maximiliana es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Maximiliana junto a su esposo tienen una tienda donde vende computadoras y accesorios, el local es alquilado y esta ubicado en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realizan hace 3 años y poco a poco esta mejorando ahora cuenta con personal técnico.

Maximiliana necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de accesorios de computadora como fuentes, estabilizador y tintas.

Los sueños de Maximiliana son comprar una casa en el centro de la ciudad y tener local propio, brindar buenos estudios a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy computer accessories such as surge protectors, back-up batteries, and printer inks, for sale in her store

loans.name: Ean

texts.en: Ean S. O. raises pigs and grows rice on her farmland in Krasaing Chrum Village, Kampong Thom Province. She can make about $5 per day and her husband can earn around $5 per day fishing in the Tonle Sap Lake. They have two children who live at home with them. Because she wishes to expand her farming business, O. is requesting a loan to purchase more farmland. The loan allows her to expand her farming business and increase the family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase more farmland

loans.name: Ana Andrea

texts.en:
Ana Andrea has been preparing and selling typical Guatemalan lunches for more than 30 years. She works seven days a week from 9:00 in the morning until 5:00 in the afternoon. She has a stall in the market in San Martin Jilotepeque to sell during the market days, Thursdays and Sundays. The other days of the week she sells from the street near the market. Although there are various similar food sales, Ana Andrea’s is particularly successful because of the good variety and quality of her food. Additionally, the majority of the food shops close earlier, but because Ana Andrea stays open until 5 she takes advantage of the opportunity to serve a lot of clients that eat later in the day.

Ana Andrea is requesting this loan to buy more pigs and chickens, which she buys when they are small, fattens them up, and then later uses them for the food she sells. This is a very economical way to provide her own meat for her food, and she needs more capital to purchase additional animals, food for them, and other things that she uses in preparing her food, such as noodles, vegetables, etc. Ana Andrea is married and her husband is a farmer, growing corn and beans. They have seven grown children and ten grandchildren. Ana Andrea did not have the opportunity to go to school when she was younger and cannot read and write. Nevertheless, she is very hardworking and has built a very successful business, which she dreams of continuing to expand. With the help of this loan she can continue investing in her business and she hopes to increase her income to make some improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Ana Andrea ha estado preparando y vendiendo almuerzos típicos guatemaltecos por más que 30 años. Trabaja siete días de la semana de las 9:00 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde. Tiene un local en el mercado en San Martín Jilotepeque para vender durante los días del mercado, los jueves y los domingos. Los otros días de la semana ella vende en la calle cerca del mercado. Aunque hay varias ventas de comida semejantes, la de Ana Andrea es particularmente exitosa porque tiene buena variedad y calidad de sus comidas. Además, la mayoría de las ventas de comida cierren mas temprano, pero porque Ana Andrea queda abierta hasta las 5, aprovecha la oportunidad de servir a muchas clientes que coman mas tarde.

Ana Andrea esta pidiendo este préstamo para comprar más marranos y pollos, los que compra cuando están pequeños, los engorda, y después los usa para su comida que venta. Este es una manera muy económica de proveer su propia carne para su comida y necesita capital para comprar más animales, la comida para ellos, y otras cosas que se usa en la preparación de la comida, como fideos, verduras, etc. Ana Andrea es casada y su esposo es agricultor, cultivando maíz y fríjol. Tienen siete hijos que ya son grandes y diez nietos. Ella no tenía la oportunidad de estudiar cuando estaba joven y no puede leer ni escribir. Sin embargo, ella es muy trabajadora y ha creado un negocio muy exitoso, y sueña con seguir aumentándolo. Con la ayuda de este préstamo, ella puede seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y tiene ganas de aumentar sus ganancias para mejorar su casa.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and chickens, food for them, and other supplies for cooking meals

loans.name: Amiran's Group

texts.en:
Amiran baji is the wife of S. A. and lives in a small city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical places.

Amiran baji owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 13 years. She is the mother of six children: one son and five daughters. Her son drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Her first three daughters are just doing household work. The other two are getting education, one is in 5th standard and the other is in kindergarten.

Amiran baji's husband is a security guard by profession. Amiran baji makes handmade things, specifically ladies' ornaments, e.g., embroidered parandas (decorative tassels) and sells them at the market. She has successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her son who presently driving a rented auto-rickshaw.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her land. Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy agriculture tools to work the land and make it fertile. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy milk to re-sell. Bushra baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Firdous baji wants a loan to buy fruit to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Ejime

texts.en: Ejime O. is 45 years old and is married with 2 children. Ejime is the leader of a lending group under LAPO MICROFINANCE. Ejime sells bunches of plantains. She has been in this business for the past nine years. She buys the bunches of plantains from surrounding villages and sells at the Ajegunle main market. Ejime needs the loan amount of $1200 to buy more bunches of plantains for sale. She says this will enable her to meet the demands of her customers. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of Plantain for sale

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mr. Sam S. is a villager in Phlov Trei Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. He owns a small piece of land where he grows rice to earn a living. 

He now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to cultivate, so he has decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. With the rest of the loan, he will buy fertilizer and pesticides to support his crop. 

His wife, Mrs. Chea Huot, owns a small restaurant where she sells rice soup. Mr. Sam S. is 60 years old and the father of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory. The remaining three attend the local school. 

His wife and child are on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds to cultivate and fertilizers and pesticides to support his crop.

loans.name: Adugbe

texts.en:
Adugbe A. has been selling lobster, cassava, and corn dough at the Takoradi market since 1998. Cassava and corn dough are used in the preparation of a variety of foods in the country. Adugbe also sells smoked fish. Smoking is a way to preserve fish; smoked fish is much preferred among the Ghanaian communities because it can be kept for many days without having to be kept in a freezer.

Adugbe has received no formal education. She is married and has 4 dependents. Her husband is a mason. Adugbe is responsible for assisting her husband provide for the basic needs of their family.

Adugbe will use her loan to buy more corn and cassava to make into dough to sell, and to buy more fresh fish to process and sell. She hopes to reinvest her new profits back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more corn and cassava to make into dough to sell, and to buy more fresh fish to process and sell

loans.name: Lardi

texts.en: Lardi A. is a thirty-year-old mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She is hard-working and resourceful in caring for her family. She trades in charcoal and bags of maize, and she also sells food in her neighborhood. Lardi prepares kenkey: kenkey is prepared from milled maize and it is packaged in maize leaves and left to boil for two hours; it’s then served with hot pepper or any gravy together with fried fish. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes. Lardi obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Obuasi, where she lives, and resells it to her customers. She wants to use this loan to stock up on supplies of charcoal, maize, fish and vegetables to increase her inventory especially during this Christmas season when demand for her goods is high. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to pay her children’s educational fees and also to save some money to buy Christmas dresses and shoes for her children. She belongs to the community group called Osenkafo, meaning Evangelist Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral for repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy charcoal, maize, fish, and other supplies in bulk

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Тургунова Махбуба жительница района Джалоллидини Руми.Возраст 49 лет, замужем и имеет троих детей. Занимается торговлей. Торгует одеждой на центральном рынке. Бизнесом занимается уже 10 лет. К нам за кредитом обратилась для того, чтобы использовать деньги в своем деле. Хочет увеличить товарооборот и завезти сезонный товар. Погасить кредит может в течение 9 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahbuba T. is a resident of the Jalollidini Rumi region. She is 49 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is in trade, and for the past ten years has sold clothing at the central market. She turned to MLO Humo and Partners for a loan in order to use the money in her business. She would like to increase her turnover and to provide seasonal goods. She can repay the loan within nine months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Покупка сезонной одежды.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=53262
Carmen es socia del Bancomunal Maria Milagrosa.
Carmen tiene 27 años, es conviviente, tiene una hija de 10 años, que estudia en el colegio de Tablada de Lurin.

Los padres de Carmen son cocineros, ellos le enseñaron muchos secretos de cocina,  a ella le gusta la cocina. Empezó trabajando como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante por cuatro años,  decidió independizarse  y poner su negocio de restaurante en su casa, ella empezó con cuatro sillas y dos mesas, ahora tiene un ayudante de cocina, una azafata, y una lava platos, y ella es la que cobra. Todos los días da desayuno y menú tiene 80 comensales.     
Desde que esta en Finca, ve cómo su negocio ha crecido, antes su hijo estudiaba en una escuela del estado, ahora está en una escuela privada, le gustan las reuniones del Bancomunal.   
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de gaseosa, arroz, azúcar para surtir su restaurante.
El sueño que tiene Carmen es poner una polleria en su casa.
texts.en:
First loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=53262 Carmen is a member of Bancomunal Maria Milagrosa. Carmen is 27 years old and has a life partner. She has a ten year old daughter who is studying at the college of Tablada de Lurin. Carmen's parents are chefs. They taught her many of the secrets of cooking, and Carmen loves to cook. She worked for four years as an assistant chef in a restaurant. She has decided to become independent and make her restaurant business in her home. She started with fuar chairs and two tables. Now she has an assistant chef, a hostess, a dish washer, and she is charged. They serve breakfast every day for 80 diners. Since she has been with Finca, she has seen how her business has grown. Before, her son was studying in a state school; now he is in a private school. She enjoys the meetings of Bancomunal. Carmen needs a loan of $375 to purchase gas, rice, and sugar to supply her restaurant. Carmen’s dream is to put a poultry shop in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase gas, rice, and sugar for her restaurant

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 40 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en la casa que vienen construyendo. Ella es una mujer que podemos ver trabajando en las calles ofreciendo diversas prendas de vestir a muy bajos precios, actividad que viene desempeñándo desde hace 6 años. Gracias a la acogida que tiene por su zona pudo aumentar sus ventas y ahora  busca un puesto donde pueda vender su mercadería, por lo pronto espera seguir satisfaciendo la demanda de las personas de bajos recursos, pues es lo más agradable dentro de su labor como comerciante, ya que ayuda a las personas poniendo al alcanse de sus bolsillos lo necesario para su vestido. Lo que no le agrada es exponerse varias horas bajo el ardiente sol, que algunas veces le impide seguir su labor. Ella espera seguir creciendo como comerciante, ayudando a las personas de su zona  a tener acceso de diversos  productos que por la distancia son muy escasos. Yolanda es cliente de MFP desde hace 6 años, tiempo en que inició su negocio como comerciante. Con el dinero que solicita comprará uniformes, ya que la época de campaña escolar es muy rentable, para ello invertirá 1500 soles.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 40 years old. She lives together with her husband and her two children in the home that they are constructing. She is a woman who we can see working in the streets offering various things to wear at very low prices, an activity that she has been doing for 6 years. Thanks to the welcome that she has in her neighborhood she was able to increase her sales and now look for a stall where she could sell her merchandise. More immediately, she hopes to continue satisfying the demand of people with small resources, as it is nicer to do her work as a businesswoman, and to help the people, putting within the reach of their pockets what is needed to dress. What she doesn’t like is to be exposed for many hours to the hot sun, which several times has kept her from her work. She hopes to continue growing as a businesswoman, helping the people in her area have access to various products that because of the distance are very scarce. Yolanda has been a client of MFP for 6 years, time in which she has grown her business. With the money that she is asking for she would buy uniforms, as the time for school is very profitable, and so she would invest 1500 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for school time

loans.name: Surayohon

texts.en:
Surayohon Z. is 36 years old. She is married with 3 children and she lives in Khujand. Surayohon first applied to MicroInvest in 2008 when she was in need of financial support for importing a new assortment of goods from China. Since that moment, Surayohon has applied permanently to the MicroInvest loan procedure as she trusts it and she is going to continue her co-operation to help in her small business development.

Surayohon trades in women's clothing, bathing suits, and night wear. Surayohon brings her assortment from China and Istaravshan. She has a good assortment and repeat customers. Surayohon has applied to Kiva with the request of a business support loan of 500 STJ for 5 months to increase trade outlet size.

loans.use: To increase trade outlet size

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is single and has two older children. She works in the Belo Market selling goods from her small store. With this loan, Regina plans to purchase one bag of rice, five bags of salt, 10,000cfas (approx. $20) worth of dry fish, ten tins of gari (local vegetable), lots of onions and Maggi (a local, popular sauce used for cooking). 

This is Regina's second loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2007. She thinks she has a good business that is successful. She thinks this because she sells her items to her customers on a daily basis and knows that they need what she offers.  

Having lost her son two years ago and having to pay for her daughter to go to the hospital when she fell ill, Regina has fought some battles recently. She still continues to support her children’s needs through her business. With the profits of this loan, Regina wants to continue to eat better and purchase some new kitchen utensils. She prefers GHAPE loans not only because of the preferable loan conditions but also because of the business skills she was able to acquire with the GHAPE training.  
  
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase provisions for store

loans.name: Huriniso

texts.ru: Омонлаханова Хуринисо-женщина 34 лет. Замужем имеет 2-х детей. Хуринисо занимается продажей пряжи и носков. Она сама имеет дома домашний скот. Она занимается откормом скота. Хуринисо также занимается дома переработкой и вязанием шерстенных носков и разных вещей. Хуринисо реализует аштском  районе рынках Оппон, Ошоба , Мархамат и Булок. Хуринисо хочет купить скот на полученный  займ частично пряжу и получит прибыль. Она имеет достаточный опыт в этой сфере общий стаж 10 лет.
texts.en:
Huriniso A. is a 34-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. Huriniso sells yarn and socks, and at home she raises livestock. Huriniso additionally works out of her home knitting wool socks and other items that she sells at the Asht regional markets: Oppon, Oshoba, Marhamat and Bulok. Huriniso wants to purchase cattle and yarn with the loan she received and to make a profit. She has considerable experience in these endeavors, ten years of experience overall.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle and yarn

loans.name: Ahmajon

texts.ru: Гафуров  Ахмаджон – молодой  человек  28  лет,  женат,  имеет  2-х  детей. Вместе  со  своей  женой  на  продовольственном  рынке  Спитаменского  района он  продаёт  хозяйственные  товары  и  фарфоровую  посуду.  Один  раз  в  неделю  он  ездит  за  товаром  в  г. Худжанд  и  в  Республику  Узбекистан.  Недавно  родители  Ахмаджона  построили  ему  новый  дом,  поэтому  для  расширения  своего  товарооборота  он  обратился  в  нашу  организацию  за  кредитом.  На  заработанные  деньги  Ахмаджон  и  его  семья  собираются  купить  мебель  для  своего  нового  дома.  Ахмаджон  очень  рад  сотрудничеству  с  нами  и  благодарен  нашим  кредиторам  за  помощь  в  осуществлении  его  планов.
texts.en:
Ahmajon G. is a young man of 28, married and has two children. He and his wife sell household goods and chinaware at the Spitamen district food market. Once a week, Ahmajon goes to Khujand and to Uzbekistan on a buying trip. Recently his parents built him a new house, and in order to expand the selection of goods he carries, Ahmajon came to MicroInvest for a loan. With the money he earns, Ahmajon and his family plan to buy furniture for their new home. Ahmajon is pleased to collaborate with MicroInvest and grateful for the loan assistance to bring his plans to fruition.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory expansion

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Mrs. Emma B. is 45 years old, married and blessed with four children. She lives in Mauswagon, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Currently, she seeks loan of 3,000.00 PHP to buy fertilizer for corn production. She only has a simple future plan for her family: that her children finish school through college and find decent and stable jobs someday.

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo C. is from the town of Agusan, Camp Phillips Bukidnon. He is 28 years old. Romeo is single. To make a living, Romeo owns & operates a business providing motorcycle service in their village, locally known as habal habal. He drives his motorcycle every day to generate more income. Romeo has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Romeo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to engage in business activities. Romeo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Romeo is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to make the full payment of the motorcycle used for his business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Romeo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family and for daily allowance of his siblings in school. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: the full payment of the motorcycle used for the business.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans A. is a single parent who has two children. He has received schooling through senior high education. Evans sells electronics items such as slightly used irons, TVs, car batteries and cassette recorders in Kpando, which he has done since 2007. Evans uses his income for housekeeping expenses.  With the high demand for Evans' gadgets, he will use the loan to purchase to more of the slightly used electrical gadgets to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Evans plans to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: To more inventory

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn D. owns and operates a specialized retail store buying and selling charcoal in her community. She is 29 years old, married and has five school-age children. They are from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Jocelyn has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase charcoal to sell. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay the tuition fees of her children.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita L. is from the village of Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 67 years old. Teresita is widowed and has eight adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1997, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is twenty – eight years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, a son and a daughter who are both in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Rhoda is a trader. She trades in textiles – under wears for ladies and ready-made clothes. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. She procures her goods from Accra. Rhoda has been in business for ten years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: Tep N., 47, owns a small grocery store next to her house where she sells cooking supplies for her neighbors in the village. She usually buys produce in bulk from a marker supplier to resell in order to gain income. She is a widowed mother who has given birth to two teenage children; two of whom are employed. Tep’s first daughter is a garment worker, while the last one works for a hotel. both daughters provide their income to meet their family's financial crisis. Tep N. applies for a loan to purchase a larger amount of cooking items to continue selling.

loans.use: to purchase a larger amount of cooking items to sell.

loans.name: Saada

texts.en: Saada is a 43-year-old married woman who lives with her husband. In 2008, she and her husband decided to open a mini-market to help improve their living situation.
