Today, Saada is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy more products and merchandise for the mini-market so she can increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more products and merchandise

loans.name: Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
Here are Gbassay C., Posseh B. and Kadiatu K.. They call their group "Sorbeh," a Temne word, meaning “hard work.” They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan that these entrepreneurs are borrowing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profits, and improve their standards of living. 

Gbassay C. (on the right in the photograph) is the leader of this group. Gbassay was born in Port Loko, in Northern Sierra Leone. She is now twenty-nine years old. She is married to a driver and they have one child who is in class six. Gbassay C. sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil in Sierra Leone) and “gara lapper” (locally-dyed clothes, sometimes with fabricated designs). She has five years of experience in this trade.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For purchasing needed tools and materials.

loans.name: Cobra

texts.en:
Cobra R. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 53 years old. Cobra is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Cobra owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Cobra has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cobra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cobra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cobra is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Cobra from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: George Doliro Group

texts.en:
George D. is from the village of Calabayan Minanga, Angadanan, Isabela. He is 33 years old. George is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is George D..

George is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, George owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a welding shop/steel fabrication. George has been engaged in his business for over 3 years, and earns approximately Php 12,000 a month from these activities.

In 2006, George joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. George has successfully repaid a previous loans  from ASKI. George is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by George from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan” desD. hace 10 años atrás del distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 54 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 8 hijos. Francisca no estudió y se dedica a la compra y venta D. cereales.
Francisca nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital y así comprar habas, cebada y chuño.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar cañihua, quinua, tunta, cebada y habas.
Su sueño para el futuro es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que màs le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Francisca has been a partner of the communal bank "San Juan" for 10 years now. She is from the district and province of Yunguyo in the department of Puno. She is 54 years old, married, and has 8 children. Francisca did not attend school, and she makes a living by purchasing and selling grains. With the first loan she solicited from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, of 300.00 nuevos soles, she was able to increase her capital and thereby purchase beans, barley, and potato flour. Now she is requesting a credit of 1000.00 nuevos soles, with which she will be able to buy cañihua, quinoa, tunta, barley, and beans. Her dream for the future is for her children to become professionals. The thing she likes most about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potato flour, cañihua, quinoa, tunta, barley, and beans

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Pedro tiene 68 años, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, uno de los hijos depende de él: Luís Alberto que tiene 26 años que estudia en la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco la carrera profesional de Educación Física. El socio Pedro vive en la ciudad de Pisaq departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

El socio tenía se dedica a la compra y venta de artesanías. El socio nos cuenta que compra la artesanía en la ciudad de Pisaq de los artesanos como bisutería y collares de cerámica y después una vez al mes con su hijo Cesar llevan la artesanía personalmente al país de Brasil específicamente a la ciudad de Sao Paulo donde ahí lo distribuye a las tiendas brasileñas y peruanas. Ya son 6 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más artesanías y para los gastos del viaje. 
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our client Pedro is 68 years old and married with 4 children, one of whom is still dependent on him (his son Luis Alberto, 26, who is studying Physical Education at the Universidad San Antionio Abad del Cusco). Pedro lives in the city of Pisaq, in Cusco department, and is a member of the "Mamacha Asunta" Communal Bank at Asociación Arariwa. Pedro buys and sells crafts for a living. He tells us that he buys the crafts (like jewelery and ceramic necklaces) in Pisaq from artisans, and once a month he and his son Cesar take the crafts to Sao Paolo, Brazil and distribute them to Brazilian and Peruvian stores. He has been in this line of work for the past 6 years, and it has gone very well for him, thanks to his dedication to his work. He is a hard-working, entrepreneurial father who is trying to help his family get ahead in life. He needs this loan to buy more crafts and pay for his travel costs. Pedro is grateful for the opportunity he has been offered, and is committed to repaying his loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: l socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más artesanías y para los gastos del viaje.

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.en:
Nurullo is married with five children. He’s a market vendor from Dushanbe where he sells women’s shoes and clothing. Nurullo is very enterprising, has vast experience working as a vendor and is full of creative ideas. A reasonable pricing policy and client-friendly service has always been priorities in his work and have helped to ensure the success of his business. Nurullo has been running his business for nine years. Currently, Nurullo is requesting a loan of $2,700 USD to increase his inventory. He believes that having this additional turnover capital will help him minimize his sales risk and provide stable financial support for his family. Moreover, it will help him get closer to his ultimate goal of purchasing a big store of his own.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie L., 29 years old, is a married woman who supports her family by fish vending. She lives in Sto. Catinggib, Barangay Suay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental, with her husband and their three children who are between 5 and 10 years old and still studying. Rosemarie has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish-vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 18,000. Rosemarie is now borrowing Php 12,000 so that she is able to expand her fish-vending business. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was paid off within its term and was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Rosemarie aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Janny Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Janny Maribel A. G., tiene 23 años de edad vive en el Barrio de la Francia, es casada y sus esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad aportando a los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene 3 hijos pequeños el cual el mayor comienza a asistir a la escuela primaria.


Ellos se dedican desde hace 10 años a la agricultura y dentro de los principales problemas que han enfrentado han sido la falta de agua potable que afecta a gran medida a la zona, dentro de los planes del futuro esta la ampliación de la finca para la obtención de mayores ingresos, asi como la compra de un tanque de almacen de agua que aporte el vital liquido a los miembros de la familia, para esto si primero desea realizar una inversión de capital en la  compra de materiales fertilizantes que brinden un mejor mantenimiento a las tierras y ayuden a la produccion y que favorezca a futuro planes que se tienen para la familia.
texts.en:
Janny Maribel A. G. is 23 years old. She lives in a neighborhood called De la Francia. She is married, and her husband works as a security guard, contributing to the household expenses. The couple has 3 small children, with the oldest starting primary school. For the past 10 years, they have worked in agriculture. Among the main problems they have faced has been the lack of potable water, which affects a large portion of their area. Among their plans for the future are expanding their farm in order to obtain a better income, as well as purchasing a water storage tank to provide this vital liquid to the members of their family. Toward this aim, Janny first wants to make a capital investment in fertilizers, which will allow her to maintain her fields more effectively, improve production, and support her plans for the family's future.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizers to maintain her fields

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fish and vegetables to sell

loans.name: God Is Good Group

texts.en: For 7 years, John K. has been selling palm oil at the Kingsville #7 Community, which is located near Monrovia, Liberia. He is 56 years old, married and has three children who range in age from 20 to 29 years old. He is friendly with his customers which keeps them returning. John plans to use his 8,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 40,000 LRD group loan to buy more palm oil. His goal is to grow his business and to continue to support his children by giving them good medical attention. John is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "God Is Good". In the photo that accompanies this profile, John is the one holding the sign. Joseph T. is in the inset at the lower right. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, this non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is forty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are aged fifteen and fourteen years. Both of her children are currently in school. Janet lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in their community. She works hard to support her husband, a saw miller, to provide for the family financially. 

Hard-working Janet is a dressmaker. She has been in the dress-making business for twenty-two years. Though Janet owns the shop in which she works, she yearns to get another shop and also help her husband to put up a house to accommodate the family. 

Janet intends to procure textiles and sewing accessories in bulk with the loan. It is also Janet’s dream to buy a taxi for commercial purposes.

loans.use: To buy textiles and sewing accessories

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional jewelry.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a wife of M. I. and she lives in a city named Vehari, in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 25 years. She has given birth to two children: one son and one daughter. Her daughter is 10 years old and her son is 4 years old. Her husband is a daily wage laborer and he earns approximately PKR 400 daily. His income allows him to manage the financial expenses of his family.

Khalidas’ brother is also lives with her and runs his own bedsheets selling business. He has been in this business for over 10 years. 
Khalida is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) to invest capital in her brother's business so that he may purchase more bedsheets and earn profit from the investment.

loans.use: To purchase more bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Kennedy Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Las Emprendedoras Kennedy, se conformo en fecha 25 de setiembre del 2.009.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Blanca quien se dedica a la venta de frutas, ella posee un puesto de venta en el mercado donde debe ir muy temprano para vender sus productos. 
Ella además de vender frutas actualmente también quiere ofrecer en su puesto verduras, ella  solicita el préstamo para la compra de verduras como cebolla, tomates, pimientos, manzana, naranjas y otros.
texts.en:
This committee of women is named “Las Emprendedoras Kennedy” (The Kennedy Entrepreneurs) and was established on September 25, 2009. They all participate in fundraising activities and help each other meet the goals they have in common with one another and with Fundación Paraguaya. One of the members is Sra. Blanca who sells fruit. She has a vending post at the market where she arrives early to sell her products. In addition to fruit, Blanca wants to start offering vegetables from her stand. She is requesting a loan to buy produce such as onions, tomatoes, peppers, apples, oranges, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Benkadi  5 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 5  est composé de femmes mariées du village de Djigonso  de la préfecture de San,  région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 36 ans, au moins 6 enfants et cultivent  du riz. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts solidaires, elles  sont venues au  prêt de campagne. C’est leur  premier prêt  de campagne.
Alima C. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence de riz, des petits équipements et des intrants pour la culture. 
Alima s’approvisionne  au grand marché de Bla. Après l’hivernage, sa récolte (une partie consommée) est stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ait de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de Bla et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Alima C. tout comme les autres membres du groupe Benkadi 5 compte réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 45.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi Group is made up of married women from the village of Djigonso, San prefecture, in Ségou Region (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families. Their average age is 36; each has at least six children and is a rice farmer. Hoping to improve the efficiency of their farming operations, the group's members decided to take part in Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They have repaid their membership loans, and are now ready for their first business loan. Alima C. plans on using her loan to buy rice seed, small tools and fertilizer. She will get them at the big market in Bla. Once winter is over, she will use some of what she harvests and keep the rest long enough for the price to rise before selling it at Bla and in other local markets, mostly by selling it directly to customers but also wholesaling it. Her customers mostly come from large towns. After she has sold her produce, Alima C. (like other group members) hopes to realize a profit of 45,000 FCFA, to be used to service her loan and to pay for ongoing family expenses.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice seed, fertilizer and small farming tools

loans.name: Maritza Maribel

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 24 años de edad, reside en Jucuapa del departamento de Usulután, es casada, vive con el esposo y pequeña hija de 3 años de edad, posee un negocio de venta de tortas y hamburguesas.
Ella inicialmente trabaja como empleada aprendió el negocio y emprendió su propia venta de tortas y hamburguesa, cuanta con dos años de experiencia en el negocio, trabajando en horario de 9:00am-6:00pm, es una persona muy alegre que le gusta hacer bien su trabajo.
Actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para compra de panes, lechuga, carne, mayonesa, salsa de tomate, y otros ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de de tortas y hamburguesas, esto contribuirá a la continuidad del negocio de Maritza, tener productos para vender.
Las aspiraciones de martiza son tener un negocio fuerte, atraer clientes, para contribuir a mejorar el sistema de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Maritza is 24 years old. She lives in Jucuapa in the Usulután department. She is married and lives with her husband and 3 year old daughter. She has a business selling sandwiches and hamburgers. She started as an employee and learned the business. She opened her own business selling sandwiches and hamburgers and has been doing it for two years, working from 9:00 a.m. - 6:00 pm. She is a very cheerful person who likes to do her job well. Presently, she is asking for a loan to buy buns, lettuce, meat, mayonnaise, ketchup and other ingredients necessary for making sandwiches and hamburgers. This will contribute to the continuity of Maritza's business, having products to sell. Maritza's aspirations are to have a strong business, and attract customers in order to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy buns, lettuce, meat, mayonnaise, ketchup and other ingredients

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira O. is from the village of Pedlagahan, Santiago, Gingoog City. She is 43 years old. Elvira is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store, making and selling coconut and other kind of wood charcoals in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating the business. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elvira from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Samwelly Chola

texts.en:
Samwelly P. is 42 years old and a timber dealer in Bamburi, Mombasa. He is married to one wife who supports his income, and they have two children.

Samwelly has been in the business for the last four years and being a new KADET member he plans to expand his timber business with the first loan he is requesting. In future he plans to expand more and more with the anticipated profit and succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for his inventory

loans.name: Shadaan

texts.en:
Shadaan lives in a small city called Kasur which is located near Lahore, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its leather industry. She is married to M. H. who is 60 years old and has a business selling milk. He operates his business from his home where he keeps three buffalos.

Shadaan is a housewife but she also helps her husband in his business. She takes care of buffalos by giving them food and water on time and by keeping their place clean to make sure they don’t catch any disease.

Shadaan has given birth to three sons and a daughter. Her children left their education and started to work at an early age to support the family. All three sons are now attached to a shoemaking business, working in a factory near their home on monthly wages. Her daughter sews clothes for her neighborhood clients.

Shadaan has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo which will increase the milk production. As a result, her husband will be able to supply a larger quantity of milk and earn more income.

Shadaan is a regular loan user of Asasah and is on her 3rd loan. Over the years she has maintained a good credit record and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To purchase another buffalo for her husband's dairy business

loans.name: Johaida

texts.en: Johaida T. is a married woman who lives in Jesusito Village, Brgy. San Jose, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a tricycle transport business. Her husband Edison, who is 48 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who range from 10 to 25 years old. Johaida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Johaida has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to purchase one motorcycle with a sidecar so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Johaida T. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase a transport vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more consignment of medicine (drugs)

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz María es una comerciante de frutas, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 28 años de edad y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas; La venta de frutas está ubicada frente al mercado municipal de El Transito y lleva dedicándose a este negocio desde hace aproximadamente 5 años, las frutas que ella ofrece a las personas que circulan por esta zona son mangos, jocotes, sandias, pepino y aquellas que son de temporada.
Ella quiere invertir en su negocio comprando aquellas frutas de más duración adquiriéndolas por una mayor cantidad y se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para esta inversión; este préstamo ayudara a su crecimiento con el negocio y posiblemente aumente las ventas.
Su Objetivo es crecer como comerciante y generar los ingresos necesarios para el bienestar de sus hijas y su esposo.
texts.en:
Luz María is a fruit merchant.  She lives in El Transito, San Miguel department.  She’s 28 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters.  Her fruit stand is located in front of the El Transito Municipal Market.  She has been in this business for about 5 years.  The fruit she sells to people passing by are: mangoes, jocote (a tropical fruit known as Red Mombin, Purple Mombin, Hog Plum, and Sineguela), watermelon, cucumber and whatever is in season.

She wants to invest in her business buying at wholesale fruits that last longer.  She needs to request a loan for this investment.  The loan will help her business grow and possibly lead to increased sales.

Her goal is to grow as a merchant and generate the necessary income for her husband’s and daughters’ wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy fruit.

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
La Señora Flor de María S. H.,  inicia sus ventas de las 6 am ofertando su producto en su tramo y finaliza sus labores a las 12 pm, inició su negocio como vendedora ambulante en los tres mercados de la ciudad de león (Mercado Central, La Estación y la Terminal) con un capital de trabajo de C$ 1,000.00 producto de aporte de su mamá. Este crédito fue utilizado para  compra de productos como blusas, toallas, ropa interior, camisolas, tobilleras, etc.
La señora S. se siente muy satisfecha y agradecida con los créditos que CEPRODEL le ha brindado ya que ha incrementado su inventario ofertando diferentes productos y obteniendo mayores ganancias y así ha logrado realiza las compras de sus enseres del hogar.
texts.en:
Ms. Flor de María S. H. starts her sales at 6 AM, offering her products at her stand and finishing work at 12 PM.  She started her business as an itinerant vendor at the three markets in León (Central Market, The Station, and The Terminal), with $1,000 córdobas [approximately $46 USD] of capital provided by her mother.

She is using this loan to buy products like blouses, towels, undergarments, camisoles, socks, etc.  Ms. S. feels very satisfied and grateful for the loans that CEPRODEL has offered her, as she has increased her inventory to offer different products.  She has earned better profits and been able to purchase certain items for her household.

loans.use: to buy undergarments, shirts, cute clothes, women's blouses, and pants

loans.name: Soraya

texts.es: La Sra.  Soraya, se dedica a la Venta de peluches desde ya hace bastante tiempo y con el apoyo de sus esposo Don Edson han venido trabajando de forma conjunta para el crecimiento de la actividad que emprenden en Zonas tales como la Villa y Cumavi, de esta forma es que ellos han seguido adelante, ya que cuentan con un pequeño niño al cual quieren brindarle un mejor futuro. Actualmente ellos se ven en la necesidad de comprar un motor nuevo para su vehículo, el cual fue adquirido con mucho sacrificio y trabajo, ya que este no solo es utilizado para el transporte de su mercadería sino también como transporte urbano. La  señora es cliente antigua de la institución y ha demostrado ser excelente cliente, esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Soraya has sold stuffed toys for a long time with her husband, Edson’s, help.  They have been working together towards the business’ growth which they undertake in areas like Villa and Cumavi.  This is how they have continued to get ahead.  They have a small son that they want to provide with a better future.

They bought their vehicle with much sacrifice and work.  They now need to buy a new engine for it because it’s not only used to transport their merchandise but also as urban transport.

Soraya is a longstanding client of the institution and has shown herself to be an excellent client. She is grateful to Emprender for the support they have provided.

loans.use: To buy a motor for her vehicle.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María, de 34 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y humilde, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo, hija y su hijo Manuel. Con mucho esfuerzo, María se abastece de mercadería como prendas de vestir y sandalias, para ser vendidos de manera ambulante por las calles de su zona y en as periferias de la avenida principal de su distrito, ya que es ahí donde hay más afluencia de gente. Le gusta mucho su trabajo,  porque le es muy rentable, además por que se mantiene muy ocupada, a pesar de las dificultades que pasa por ser informal ya que corre riesgo que el municipio le quite sus cosas. En adelante, desea encontrar un puesto en algún mercado para continuar trabajando de manera estable. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin darle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con el crédito que recibirá, piensa abastecerse de mercadería, para continuar trabajando en su negocio.
texts.en:
María, 34, is a a very hard-working and humble mother.  She lives in her own house, together with her father, her daughter, and her son, Manuel.  Through her great efforts, she has stocked her business with merchandise like clothing items and sandals.  She sells her merchandise throughout the streets in her area, as well as around the periphery of her district's principal avenue, which is where the most affluent people are.  She truly enjoys her work because it is very profitable and because it keeps her very busy.  She enjoys it despite its difficulties, such as the fact that because it is an informal business, she runs the risk that the municipal government could take her things away.

In the future, she would like to find a stand in some market where she can continue her work in a more stable manner.  This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  She knows that if she repays it on time, it will be easier to get another loan in the future, and she won't cause any complications for her communal bank, where she is well-loved. She plans to use the loan she will receive to stock up on merchandise so that she can continue working at her business.

loans.use: to buy items of clothing to stock her business

loans.name: Nolan Yuran

texts.es: Nolan tiene 25 años, tiene 4 años de ser cliente de Fundación y con mucho orgullo ha logrado salir adelante.  Su negocio es la venta y compra de mercadería en general, hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio por lo que ha sido muy reconfortante para él. Uno de sus mayores desafíos ha sido que ofrece muy poca variedad de productos pues sus clientes siempre le están solicitando variedad en sus productos. Este crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, calzado, cosméticos entre otros actualmente tiene una gran variedad de pedidos.
texts.en:
Nolan is 25 years old.  He has been a client of Fundación Leon 2000 for 4 years and he has very proudly managed to get ahead in life.  His business is buying and selling general merchandise.  He has had his business for more than 4 years which has been very comforting for him.  One of his greatest challenges has been that he doesn't offer a very wide variety of products and his customers are always requesting a greater variety of products.

Nolan will use this loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, footwear, cosmetics, etc.  He currently has a large number of orders.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mujeres Maravillas Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité inicio  la señora Adelaida G., quien vive en el km 7  barrio Mburucuja, ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina “Mujeres Maravilla”, está constituido  por  17  señoras muy activas y solidarias todas de la misma zona. 
Ellas tienen actividades diferentes, otras  que emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un  ingreso fijo. 
Una de las integrantes es la Ignacia quien se dedica a venta de ropas desde un puesto de venta que posee en su casa, para la atención del mismo la ayuda toda su familia dependiendo de la disponibilidad de cada uno. 
Ella comenta que viaja hasta en los países vecinos para la compra de las mercaderías  ya que ahí los precios son muchos bajos. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra remeras, shorts, vestidos y otros.
texts.en:
This committee was founded by Adelaida G. who lives in Km 7 neighborhood, in Mburucuja.  She contacted her neighbors and friends to form a commitee in her area.

The committee is called "Mujeres Maravilla" (Wonder Women).  It has 17 very active and supportive members who are all from the same area.

Some of the women already have business activities, others have a regular income and are setting up new businesses.

One of the members of this committee is Ignacia who sells clothes from a sales location that she has set up in her own home.  Her entire family help her to serve in her store, depending on who is available.

Ignacia comments that she travels to neighboring countries to buy her merchandise since the prices there are much lower.  She is requesting her loan to buy t-shirts, shorts, dresses, etc.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shorts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Gilberta

texts.es:
Gilberta tiene 46 años, es madre soltera de una hija llamada Elma, de 12 años, juntas viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Samugari, selva de Ayacucho.

Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado cultivar Gilberta, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida y la de su pequeña hija. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de cacao, café y hoja de coca, dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuando los ve grandes y abundantes. Lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y cuenta con el apoyo de sus jornaleros, ella considera que lo más difícil es llevar lo cosechado hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, que es donde los vende, ya que los sacos donde lleva los productos son muy pesados, es por ello tiene que pagar para transportarlos. Para más adelante, espera mejorar sus productos, para así poder obtener mejores precios.

Este es el 11avo préstamo de Gilberta con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable.
Los mil nuevos soles solicitados le servirán para pagar a los jornaleros, pues gracias al apoyo de ellos sus productos marchan muy bien.
texts.en:
Gilberta is 46 years old.  She is a single mother and has one daughter called Elma who is 12 years old.  They live together in their own home which is located in Samugari district, in the jungle of Ayacucho.

The products that Gilberta has managed to grow through so much hard work and commitment have helped her a lot in making progress in her own life and her young daughter's life.  Every morning she goes out to work her land since she knows that the quality of her cacao, coffee and coca leaf crops depends on the care she takes of them.

What Gilberta most likes about her work is caring for her crops and she feels very happy when she sees them grow large and plentiful.  She has been in this business for 6 years and she has the support of some laborers.  She considers the most difficult part of her work to be taking her harvested crops to the city of San Francisco to sell since the sacks are very heavy.  For this reason, she has to pay for somebody to transport them.  In the future, Gilberta hopes to improve her produce so that she can obtain better prices.

This is Gilberta's 11th loan with MFP.  She knows that she must make her repayments on time and she is prepared to do this.  Gilberta is a very supportive and responsible member of her community bank.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to pay her laborers since, thanks to their support, her crops are doing well.

loans.use: To pay her laborers

loans.name: Sabati Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Sabati, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Dioni, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de poissons, de condiments et d’arachide.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Sabati sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
ASSAN T. compte acheter des poissons fumés aussi bien que frais avec les revendeurs de Konobougou et cela chaque semaine. Elle revend sur place à Konobougou et en cas de mévente le reste sera vendu au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, une partie pour prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires de ses enfants et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The seven women in the group Sabati are all married; their average age is 41 years old and they each have an average of three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the town of Diono, within the prefecture of Barouéli, which is in the region of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They know each other through family connections and their business is selling fish, condiments and ground nuts. The women of the group Sabati are requesting their third group loan.
Assan T. will purchase smoked and fresh fish from the vendors in Konobougou every week.She will re-sell these goods in Konobougou and, when necessary, will sell the remaining stock in her town.She will sell her goods for cash, or credit to a customer base of men and women. She expects to earn a monthly profit of 15,000 CFA, which she will use to repay her loan. She will use part of her earnings to help pay for medical expenses, food and her children's school tuition. She will re-invest the rest of her earnings in her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg, 51, is married and lives with her husband and elderly father in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her husband is unemployed and helps her with the cafe business, which they started in 2010. Before starting the cafe she worked as a tailor for a clothing shop. They opened their cafe by using their own working capital. At the beginning the cafe business was slow but now they have regular customers and the business has expanded compared to the beginning. 

Oyunchimeg is a very neat and polite person who says, "We are trying to expand our cafe and open a restaurant in the future." She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy equipment and food for their cafe.

loans.use: To buy equipment and food for the cafe

loans.name: Lala Lemou

texts.fr:
Madame LALA LEMOU T. a 47 ans, elle réside avec son époux et leurs sept  enfants à Noumousso, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Kadiolo ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame LALA LEMOU T., fait la commercialisation de boubous bazins  et d’encens il y a plus de 10 ans. Elle mène son activité dans sa famille au quartier Noumousso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits et de sa crédibilité. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle a sollicité l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Son prêt lui permettra d’acheter,  20 pièces de pagnes bazins(riche – moins riche)  10kg de graines de “magnon kisenin - gueunnin” et 15 bouteilles de parfums à Bamako. Après teinture et couture des pagnes bazins, les boubous sont vendus. De même que les graines et parfums après transformation sont vendus. Elle les vend au comptant et à crédit à Kadiolo à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes à domicile et de façon ambulante.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé en grande partie pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en: Madam  Lala Lemou T. is 47 and lives with her husband and their 7 children in Noumousso, one of the popular district of the city of Kadiolo (third administrative region of Mali). Madam  Lala Lemou T. sells boubous bazin (African tunics) and incense for more than 10 years. She set up her family business in the district of Noumousso where her clients really appreciate the quality of her products and her credibility. To meet the needs of her clients which are getting bigger and bigger, she is applying to a loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The loan will allow her to buy 20 pieces of pagnes bazins (a type of cloth), 10Kg of seeds of "magnon Kisenin-gueunnin" and 15 bottles of perfume in Bamako. After dyeing and sewing the pagnes bazins, the boubous are sold. The seeds and perfumes are also sold after being transformed. She sells her products door to door to men and women as an itinerant saleswoman for cash and on credit. She plans of making a monthly profit of 150 000 FCFA thanks to the loan. The loan will be used to grow her business, help with her family's expenditures et pay off her loans and interests.

loans.use: To buy divers articles

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is a 56-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store, a food production sales business and a trisikad transport business.  She lives in Lapu-Lapu, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, food production sales and trisikad transport businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 13,400. Lorna is borrowing PHP 18,000 to purchase more stock to sell.  This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lorna aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Lesther Moises

texts.es: Lesther Moisés tiene 29 años, su actividad es una pulpería en donde ofrece una gran variedad de productos, ya que la mayoría de sus vecinos le solicitan una gran cantidad productos para el hogar. Tiene más de 5 años en su negocio en donde ha logrado aprender a tratar a sus clientes y esforzarse por obtener el pan de cada día para su hogar, Lesther tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo. Trabaja actualmente desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche pues es bien solicitado por el amplio inventario que posee. Este crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, pan, jugos, gaseosas, golosinas.
texts.en: Lesther Moises is 29 years old and runs a small grocery store where he offers a great variety of products. The majority of his neighbors come looking for a large quantity of products for their homes. He has been in this business for 5 years, during which he has learned how to treat his customers and to work hard to get his daily bread for his home. Lesther has one young son in his care.  He currently works from 6:00am until 10:00pm, since he is in high demand for the large inventory that he carries.  This loan will be used to buy basic grains, detergents, bread, juices, sodas and snacks.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, detergent, bread, juices, sodas, and snacks

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margaret is 26 and married with 2 children. Margaret owns & operates a store  selling food & daily use products in the local community.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.

Margaret needs a loan of 1000 Samoan tala (WST) to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or roughly US $146 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Margaret joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Margaret's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs.Oyuntsetseg is a 52 year old nurse. She works in a hospital. Her husband is a taxi driver and runs a taxi business, using the family car, bringing extra income for the family. They live with their two daughters and one grandson in ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Mrs.Oyuntsetseg is applying for a loan to buy tires, two shock absorbers and some spare parts for the engine to service her family's car. Her husband uses this car as a taxi.

loans.use: To buy tires, two shock absorbers and some spare parts for the engine of the family's car, which her husband uses as a taxi.

loans.name: Abd

texts.en:
Abd is a 42-year-old entrepreneur. He is married, and has four children living with him.  Abd has a falafel restaurant. Falafel is a ball or patty made from ground chickpeas and/or fava beans. Falafel is usually served in a pita, which acts as a pocket, or wrapped in a flatbread known as lafa. The falafel balls are topped with salads, pickled vegetables, hot sauce, and drizzled with tahini-based sauces. Falafel balls may also be eaten alone as a snack or served as part of a "meze".

Generally accepted to have first been made in Egypt,where the dish is widely known as طعمية (ta'amiya) in Egyptian Arabic, falafel has become a dish eaten throughout the Middle East.The Copts of Egypt claim to have first made the dish as a replacement for meat during Lent. The hearty fritters are now found around the world as a replacement for meat and as a form of street food.

Abd has been working at preparing and selling falafel since 1985. His customers include community members from his region, in addition to tourists and passers-by. Abd  says that he is passionate about his work and that he could not imagine a life without it, because it introduces him to different populations and  cultures, and it provides his family with a good enough income  to satisfy his family's needs.

Abd is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. This will be his eleventh loan from Al Majmoua. In addition to a soft drink refrigerator, he is planning to buy new specialized machine for preparing falafel, necessary to increase his production since his machines are old and not as efficient as they used to be. He says that without the loan, he would not be able to provide the same level of support for his family. 

In the future, Abd says that he is planning to further expand and improve his business as much as possible.

loans.use: To buy a new specialized Falafel machine, in addition to a soft drink refrigerator.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a hardworking entrepreneur living in the Philippines. She is 39 years old and married. Jessica has four school-aged children.

Jessica has been in the business of selling cosmetics for six years. Each month, Jessica earns PHP 3,000. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. She plans to use this loan to purchase lipstick and make-up to sell.

In the future, Jessica would like to improve her business to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase lipstick and make-up to sell

loans.name: Angela Juana

texts.es: Ángela Juana se dedica a una pulpería. Hace más de 7 que tiene este medio de vida. Ella siempre esta ofreciéndoles a sus clientes un buen servicio a sus clientes, la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, la mayoría de sus vecinos son sus clientes que siempre están solicitándole diferentes productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y detergentes.
texts.en:
Ángela Juana manages a store. She has earned her living in this manner for more than seven years. Ángela always provides her customers with good service. Her business is located in her home. Most of her neighbors are her customers and they always request different products.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy basic grains, candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and detergents.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and detergents.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has been doing mixed farming in the Nkubu area for 30 years. His farm produces maize, potatoes, cabbage and milk, which he sells to the local market. He is married with five children, four of whom are adults.

Francis has placed a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says the dairy cow will improve his family's living standards and earn him more income to reinvest in the farming business. He intends to expand his dairy farm by buying at least two more dairy cows in three years.

Francis sees high costs and scarcity as his challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a Ugandan man, age 27, who needs a loan to purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil and maize flour to sell in a retail shop that he has operated for eight years. He is the father of three children, whose mother is a shopkeeper. He lives in a two-room rented house with five people that he takes care of, and he dreams of acquiring land on which to build a permanent house and educating his children. He acquired his initial capital from a driving job that he still maintains. He dreams of growing his shop into a wholesale business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Victoriosas es un comité de 10 mujeres que son muy bien organizadas, unidas, trabajadoras y solidarias unas con otras. Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Villarrica. Se reúnen mensualmente para brindarse apoyo y ayuda las unas a las otras en su esfuerzos a mejorar su situación económica.
La Sra. Miguelina es artesana, ella se dedica a esto desde pequeña ya que su madre le había trasmitido los conocimientos sobre esta profesión. Por medio de su dedicado trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y brindarle una vida decorosa y digna a su familia. Comenta que todo sacrificio es poco para lograr lo que uno quiere. Sueña con algún día poder tener un local donde exponer sus artesanías.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, bastidores, agujas y demás para la elaboración de artesanías.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Victoriosas” (Victorious Women) Group is a committee of 10 women who are well organized, united, hard workers with much solidarity, one with the other. These women are from the city of Villarica. They meet monthly to offer aid and support to one another in their efforts to improve their economic situation.

Miguelina is an artisan. She has done this work since she was a small child, when her mother transmitted her own knowledge concerning this profession. Due to her dedicated work, she has been able to get ahead and offer a decorous and dignified life to her family. Miguelina comments that all her sacrifice amounts to little compared with gaining what she wishes. She dreams of one day being able to have a shop where she can display her artisan crafts.

Miguelina request a loan to buy cloth, thread, stretchers, needles and other items for elaborating her artisan crafts.

loans.use: buy cloth, thread, stretchers, and needles for making artisan crafts.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila, aged 46, is married to Richard. They are blessed with four children: aged between four and 22 years. She operates a salon and beauty shop which has been in operation for eleven years. She earns a monthly income of KES40,000.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy hair and beauty products for her shop and salon. Petronila will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her daughter, who is in the university. She hopes to start selling second hand clothes in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair products for her salon/beauty shop.

loans.name: Tol

texts.en: Mr. Tol, age 33, has four school-age children who live as his dependents. His occupation is a farmer in Bary District, Kompong Thom Province. His wife, Mach, is 31 years old. She is a fish seller in one market not far away from her homeland. From this business, she can earn about $3 each day. Apart from these activities, Tol and his wife earn additional income by raising pigs. Presently, Tol wants to buy several pigs but lacks money. So, Tol and his wife would like to request some funds from Kiva in order to purchase piglets. Their future expectation is to have a bigger business, bigger house, and at least bachelor degrees for their children.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Ana Deysi

texts.es: Ana Deysi de 47 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el cual lo integra su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos. Para Ana su familia es  lo más importante y es por lo que trabaja duramente día a día. Ella posee un bazar en el cual vende diversidad de artículos como: zíperes, agujas, hilos, tijeras, etc. y además tiene una mini librería en el mismo lugar donde provee a alumnos de escuelas o centro de estudios cercanos. Desea poder surtir su negocio para que los clientes la prefieran más y siempre soliciten sus productos. Cuenta con la ventaja de que no tiene mayor competencia dentro de la zona por lo que su negocio es rentable y quiere explotar al máximo dicha ventaja. Ha decidido agrandar su negocio y para eso solicita este  crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar variedad de: papelería, útiles, hilos, agujas, tijeras, zíperes, etc. para mantener todo lo necesario dentro de su negocio y poder lograr atraer a más clientes de tal manera que permitan mejorar los ingresos y por consecuencia su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Ana Deysi is 47 and lives in her own home with her family, which is made up of her husband and 2 children.  For Ana, her family is the most important thing, and they are the reason she works hard day after day.  She has a bazaar where she sells diverse items like:  zippers, needles, thread, scissors, etc.  She also has a small bookstore where she serves school children and the nearby student centers.  She hopes to be able to stock her business so customers prefer her more and always request her products.  She has the advantage of not having big competition in the area where her business is.  This is why she is requesting a loan from Integral to buy a variety of products like:  paper, notions, thread, needles, scissors, and zippers to maintain everything her business needs and to be able to attract more customers.  In that way, she can improve her income and therefore the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of paper, notions, thread, needles, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Charles has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells hardware. 

To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hardware supplies, and will help Charles to generate greater profits and expand his business. Charles hopes that in the future he will be able to open another business. 

Charles is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charles who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase hardware supplies

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children, both college students, in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in the Hovd Province of Mongolia. Narantsetseg started her business in 1999 by making home utilities out of steel at her home and selling them at the local market. Her husband and children support and manage the enterprise together. 

Their family expenses are going up due to their children's college tuition fees. A hard-working and diligent woman, Narantsetseg says, "I am going to buy a car for my children so that they can earn money with it as a taxi during the weekends. Perhaps income from the taxi service will help us to cover many expenses." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy a new car and provide taxi service to the local town.

loans.use: to buy a new car.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en: Eyad is a 38-years-old man. He is married and has two sons and four daughters. He is a municipality employee with a decent salary. Eyad wants to improve his family life conditions by purchasing new home furniture such as: bedroom furniture for his children, living room seats, and others, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for this purchase so he needs to take a loan out in the amount of $1,200 from FATEN. When Eyad gets the loan which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase the home furniture his family needs and to provide his family with better and healthier living conditions. Eyad is photographed in the picture in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Tory Group

texts.es:
11 mujeres del Chaco se unieron para que por medio de su trabajo en conjunto puedan ayudar a sus familias. Ellas son mujeres luchadoras, trabajadoras y muy emprendedoras. Se encuentran actualmente en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya, y desean poder llegar al nivel máximo del mismo.
Una de las miembros es la señora Nelida, la cual se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas, trabajo que le trae muy buenos ingresos, mediante los cuales puede darle a su familia las condiciones básicas de vida digna y decorosa. desea poder seguir con su negocio, por lo que solicita la ayuda de la fundación y kiva.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo para esta nueva estación que se acerca, con lo cual podrá cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en: These eleven women from the Chaco came together in order to work together to help their families. They are determined, hardworking, enterprising women. They are currently in the first loan cycle in the Fundación Paraguaya's program for women entrepreneurs, and they'd like to make the most of it. One of the members is Nelida, who sells all kinds of clothing. Her work earns her a good income that allows her to offer her family the basic conditions for a decent, dignified life. She would like to keep going with her business, and is asking for support from the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva. She is requesting this loan to buy all kinds of clothing for the approaching season, which will help her fill her customers' requests.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: San Jose 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité San José 2 se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de  Santaní. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Ellas tienen como principal objetivo el crecimiento de cada una de ellas en todos los aspectos, quieren lograr por medio del trabajo en conjunto, la ayuda de las familias de cada una.
Una de las miembros es la señora Liz, la cual tiene un copetín. Este local le sirve de sustento, no solo de ella sino también el de su familia. Trabaja desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, pero dice que su trabajo es muy gratificante. En cuanto a los clientes manifiesta que tiene una clientela formada y que eso sería como un ingreso seguro.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de golosinas, galletitas, gaseosas, cigarrillos y otros artículos para abastecer su pequeño local, ya que estos son los artículos que más salidas tienen.
texts.en:
The San José 2 committee was formed when several neighbors from the city of Santaní got together. The members are a very close group who carry out activities that strengthen their friendship. Their main objective is for each one of the members to develop in every way possible. By working together, they want to be able to help each member’s family.

One of the members is Señora Liz who has a fast food counter. This supports not just her, but also her family. She starts work very early in the morning but says that her work is very rewarding. As far as her customers are concerned, she says that she has regular clientele and this is like having a steady income.

She is applying for the loan to buy candy, cookies, soft drinks, cigarettes and other things to stock her small restaurant, as these are the most popular items.

loans.use: to buy candy, cookies, soft drinks, cigarettes and more.

loans.name: Spencer

texts.en:
Spencer is 38 years old and is married with three children aged 6-13. They are living in their own semi-permanent house in Katikara, Uganda. His goal is to build a permanent house for his family and to educate his children.

Spencer is a hard-working man and for the last five years he has been operating a produce business. He started by farming and then saved to start the business, but he faces a challenge of poor roads and high inflation. He is requesting a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Sokorn's Group

texts.en:
Sokorn, 49, is married with four children. Two of her kids are married, the older kid works at her business and the youngest kid is still in school. Living in a rural area of Thmor Koul district, Sokorn has been raising pigs for almost five years. To better feed her family, she also runs a small store in the village selling Chinese noodles and coffee. 

Sokorn leads a group of two female members. She has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles while her group member is just with VisionFund for this cycle. She completely repaid her loans with VisionFund. The loans from VisionFund help her to have a decent living standard and buy a motorbike. 

Now she is requesting a fourth loan. She will use this loan to buy feed for her pigs. With this loan, she hopes her pigs will be healthy and fat, which will enable her to earn more income to build some savings to build a bigger house and keep her kid in school.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Risolat

texts.ru: Рисолат активная трудолюбия предпринимательница. На протяжении многих лет она занимается купле продажей женской одежды. Все ее труды идут на благосостояние семьи и содержания троих детей. Она замужем Муж работает водителем. У них  дружная семья. Вся прибыль идет на расширения товара. К праздникам и к зимнему сезону она хочет пополнить ассортимент товара. Для этого она хочет получить займ в размере 8000 сомони. Она благодарна тем, кто выручит её в нужный для нее день. Она надеется  на то что добрые люди помогут ей. Спасибо
texts.en: Risolat is an active and hardworking entrepreneur.  She has been involved in buying and selling women's clothing for many years.  All of her work goes toward the family's well-being and supporting her three children.  She is married, and her husband works as a driver.  They have a friendly family.  All of the profit is used to expand merchandise selection.  Risolat wants to expand her merchandise assortment for the holidays and winter season.  This is why she wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 8000 somoni.  She is grateful to all, who would help her out when necessary.  She hopes that kind people will help her.  Thank you.

loans.use: to expand merchandise assortment

loans.name: Abina

texts.fr:
Abina est une femme  âgé(e) de 36 ans. Elle est veuve et a 02 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé à 20ans et le dernier 14.  
Abina travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes et basins depuis 2005. Elle vend de façon ambulante à ses clients et achète à Lomé. 
Abina a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes et basins. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Abina voudrait prospérer. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Abina is a 36-year old woman. She is a widow with two children, both of whom study. The older is 20 years old, and the younger 14. Since 2005, Abina sells traditional fabrics: colorful "pagnes" and wax cloth known as "bazins." She sells as a street vendor, stocking up in Lome. Abina has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy traditional fabric of the "pagnes" and "bazins" type. She would like to reinvest in her business. In the years to come, Abina would like  her business to flourish. She says that  her revenues will help her family thrive.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabrics

loans.name: Olimboy

texts.ru: Олиму 37 лет, живет в сельской местности. Работает в колхозе старшим чабаном, пасет большое стадо овец и коз всего населения села и своё стадо также вместе с ними. Более 20 лет занимается откормом мелко-рогатого скота и постоянно держит скот дома, т.к. это занятие является основным источником доходом сельского населения. Ему в этом деле помогают младшие пастухи, а в своём хозяйстве за скотов присматривает жена Хафиза и сыновья. Корма у Олима достаточно, он получает его вместо зарплаты из колхоза, так что в этом нет никакой проблемы. В нашей организации работал несколько лет назад и сейчас снова был привлечен, так как являлся пунктуальным клиентом.
texts.en: Olim is 37 years old, and he lives in a rural area.  He works as a senior shepherd at a collective farm and watches over a large herd of sheep and goats for all of the village residents, and his own herd is also with him.  He has been involved in fattening up small livestock for over 20 years and always keeps livestock at home because this business is the primary source of income for the rural residents.  Junior shepherds help him with this business, and his wife, Hafiza, and sons watch after the livestock in his household.  Olim has plenty of fodder because he receives it in place of a salary from the collective farm, so there is no issue with the fodder at all.  He has worked with our organization several years ago and started working with us again now because he is a punctual client.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Jimy

texts.es: Jimy de 23 es un hombre soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres con sus hermanos en la comunidad nativa Villa María en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Jimy es un joven emprendedor. Desde los 17 años empezó con las actividades del campo, y a sus 23 años ya tiene experiencia en el cultivo de café y plátanos así como en el negocio de sus productos. Cuenta con 2 parcelas de terrenos, en la mayor parte tiene cultivadas plantas de café, y sólo media parcela de plátanos.  Los plátanos los cosecha cada quince días, obteniendo ingresos 2 veces al mes. En cambio el café requiere de más cuidados, pero su cosecha anual es más que gratificante. “Cada año aumenta mi producción, la última  vez coseché 8 sacos de café”, menciona orgulloso. Jimy sabe que es lo que le conviene, por eso seguirá trabajando en la tierra con la siembra de más cultivos de café y variar sus productos. Tener hijos y esposa no está en sus prioridades, crecer como persona es su principal preocupación. Éste sería su primer préstamo que obtendría gracias a su ayuda de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Acaba de formar parte del banco comunal “Los Productores Yaneshas”, del que se siente emocionado por el trabajo en grupos. Jimy, de recibir el dinero podrá iniciar una siembra de plátanos, comprando pequeños plantas de plátanos y bolsas de abono orgánicos para asegurar su sano crecimiento.
texts.en:
Jimy is an unmarried, 23 year old man.  He lives with his parents and his brothers in the native community of Villa María Alto Yurinaki in the province of Chanchamayo.  Jimy is a young entrepreneur.  He began working in the fields at 17 years old and at 23 years old, he already has experience in the cultivation of coffee and bananas as well as in the business of selling his products.  He has two parcels of land.  He has planted coffee on the bigger part of the land and bananas on only half a parcel.  He harvests the bananas every fifteen days, earning income twice per month.  The coffee requires more care but his annual harvest is more than rewarding.
“Each year my production grows. The last time I harvested eight sacks of coffee”, he mentions proudly.
Jimy knows what is suitable for him, and for this reason he will continue working the land by planting more coffee crops and varying his crops.  Having a wife and children is not his priority.  To grow as a person is his main concern.  This would be his first loan that he would obtain thanks to the help of MFP; therefore he accepts responsibility for being punctual with his monthly payments.  “Los Productores Yaneshas”, a part of the communal bank, has just formed and he feels excited about working in groups.  Receiving the money will enable Jimy to begin planting bananas and purchase small “mamones”(a native fruit) and bags of organic fertilizer to ensure healthy growth.

loans.use: to purchase banana plants and sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar es un hombre de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Cesar no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica Automotriz, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Cesar trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Cesar se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá culminar la construcción de los servicios higiénicos de su vivienda, ya que desea construir las paredes y comprar los accesorios para acondicionar su baño, de esta manera él y su familia podrán contar mayor higiene, salubridad y bienestar, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de salir adelante.

loans.use: Para la construcción de sus servicios higiénicos

loans.name: Jesugnon 1 Group

texts.fr: JESUGNON 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Salamatou(dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un certain Maurice. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Salamatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins du ménage. Salamatou a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Il y a près de cinq ans que Salamatou vend des produits vivriers dans son quartier. Salamatou exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et aux besoins du ménage. Salamatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Salamatou sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe JESUGNON 1. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.

loans.use: Acheter des produits vivriers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Español

La Sra. T. cuenta con un negocio pequeño ella vende abarrotes y papelería desde hace 13 años, lo tiene ubicado en su casa, vive con su única hija, es viuda. “Mi objetivo es seguir manteniendo mi negocio es por eso que ya cuento con artículos de papelería, desde que mi esposo falleció me he responsabilizado por sacar a adelante a mi hija, gracias a dios ella ya está grande y tarde o temprano formará una familia, anhelo agrandar mi negocio para asegurar mi futuro, solicito $1,000.00 dlls para comprar variedad de mercancía.”

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a divorced mother with one son. In order to provide for herself and her son, she started a small business selling children’s clothing in one of the local markets. Marina has been in this business for over 8 years. It is the only source of income for her family. Marina received her first loan from “Nadiya Ukraine” in 2002. Since then she has repaid 18 loans with no defaults. Operating a successful business has certainly not always been easy for Marina. Her determination and hard work have helped to keep her business stable, even after she was diagnosed with cancer and underwent a serious surgery. Marina needs some additional working capital and that is why she is requesting a loan of $1,200. She is planning to purchase children’s sweaters, T-shirts, skirts and shorts at wholesale prices to sell in her kiosk. The loan will not only help her buy more merchandise and expand her sales but will also provide a better quality of life for her and her son.
