Vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Evelia se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral como patos, pavos y gallinas. Los cria en un corral ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Una vez que los  engorda los  comercializa en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realizan desde hace más de 3 años. El destino del crédito será para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales para que logren un tamaño y peso ideal y venderlos a un mejor precio. Tambien pretende hacer mejoras en su corral para mejor proteger sus animales. Asi podrá incrementar sus inventarios y por ende las ventas. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Evelia, 29, is married and has 3 children. She lives in her own house in the tiny village of La Mónicas in the Tambogrande district, an agricultural area around Piura, more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque Region. She lives in the rural part of this district, and doesn't have basic services. 

Evelia raises and sells poultry, such as ducks, turkeys, and chickens. She raises them in a pen behind her house. Once she fattens them up she sells them in the local market. She has done this for more than 3 years. The loan will be used to purchase commercial feed for her animals to help them reach an ideal size and weight and fetch a better price. She also hopes to make improvements to her pen to better protect her animals. That way she can increase the number of birds she has and consequently her sales. For these reasons, she thought it best to request a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase commercial feed for her animals and to fix the pens for her poultry

loans.name: Mutagayara

texts.en:
Mutagayara J. is an individual client in Ibanda. J. has been a cattle seller for 6 years, from Kyembogo, and he employs casual labourers to sell to the local community. He is able to get 200,000 UGX as monthly profits and this income helps to take care of his 4 children. 

This 34 year old man is also involved in the sale of produce that he mostly buys and resells. This is a business operated by his mother. His dream is to be able to increase production as a result of his hard work. J. needs a loan to be able to buy more cattle for resale.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for resale.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Dionisia is 30 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming corn and vegetables in the Philippines. Dionisia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Dionisia has been farming corn and vegetables for 15 years and also earns additional income from selling coconut wine.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jambalsuren

texts.en: Jambalsuren is a 44-year-old widower who lives with his two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia. His older daughter is a student while the younger one is in secondary school. He manages a taxi service business in his town. He started his business in 2007. In his province public transportation hasn't been developed much. Therefore his business is quite successful which gives him much profit. With his business earnings he pays his daughter's tuition fee and feeds his family. He also conducts a meat and meat product trading business in addition to his taxi service business. He is a friendly man who is planning to continue his business in the future. He says, "I am working hard to better my life and to pay tuition fees of my children." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a new car.

loans.use: To purchase a new car

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz es un padre de familia, tiene  49 años de edad, tiene dos hijos menores de edad hijos. Cruz vive en la zona rural del distrito de Bambamarca de la ciudad de Cajamarca, en la región del mismo nombre.

Cruz  se dedica a la construcción de casas (Maestro de obras), esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 20 años en diferentes partes de la provincia, aprendió esta actividad de su padre hace varios años, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.  Cruz  cuenta con clientela fidelizada a su servicio pues, reconocen el buen trabajo que realiza, esto lo ha hecho muy conocido en su zona.

Cruz está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar madera ya que a la fecha cuenta con un contrato de construcción de una casa de materia rustico en la zona, este rubro cuenta con una competencia estable en la zona.

Cruz es un padre entregado a su trabajo muy responsable, y honesto, su más grande anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Cruz is a 49 year old father who has two young children.  Cruz lives in a rural area in the Bambamarca district in the city of Cajamarca in the region of the same name.  

Cruz works in construction building houses (foreman).  He has been doing this in different parts of the province for more than 20 years.  He learned this trade from his father many years ago, that is to say, he knows this profession well.  He has a loyal clientele that recognizes the good work he does.  This has made him well-known in the region.  

Cruz is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternativa so that he can buy wood since he has a contract to build a house of rustic materials.  The competition for this trade is stable in his area.   

Cruz is a father who is dedicated to his work and is very responsible and honest.  His greatest desire is to give his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase wood to build rustic houses.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is 48 years old and is married to Jeremiah, who is a mechanic. The couple is blessed with four children. For the past nine years Jeniffer has been running a food stall. She earns a monthly income of 7,000 KES. 

Jeniffer has a very good credit history and this will be her twelfth loan with KADET LTD. She will use her loan to buy cereals such as rice, lentils, peas, and other grains to cook and sell.  

Jeniffer will use the anticipated profit from her loan to educate her children. In the future, she hopes to have a modern restaurant.

loans.use: to buy cereals such as rice, lentils, and peas to cook and sell

loans.name: Jose Salvador

texts.es:
José, es agricultor y ganadero, vive con su familia conformada por su esposa y dos hijos de 14 y 7 años de edad, ellos son dependientes. José inicio la agricultura y ganadería por influencia de su padre, actualmente trabaja en lo propio y solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en materiales para la agricultura.
Él se dispone a sembrar maíz por lo que comprara fertilizantes y abono, este préstamo le ayudara para realizar la siembra y dar los cuidados necesarios para que produzca abundantemente.
Su objetivo es tener una buena producción, abundante y sana, proveyendo para su familia la alimentación necesaria y velando por sus hijos para que tengan acceso al estudio y se superen.
texts.en:
Jose is an agriculturist and a livestock farmer. He lives with his family, which is composed of his wife, and their two children, aged 14 and 7. They are dependents. Jose started out in agriculture and farming following the influence of his father. He works by his own accord and he requests a loan to invest in agricultural materials.

She cultivates corn so he will purchase fertilizers and manure. This loan will help him establish his plantation and to provide the necessary maintenance to have an abundant production. His objective is to have a good yield that is abundant and of good quality. It will help him provide his family with the food they need and to provide his children with an education to press forward.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and manure for his corn plantation.

loans.name: Brenda Lisseth

texts.es:
Brenda, es comerciante de cosméticos, es soltera, vive con su madre, su puesto de venta lo tiene instalado en el parque de la ciudad, vende todos los días de la semana.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería, más que todo productos de belleza como maquillaje, labiales, cremas, prendedores de cabello, esta inversión será un gran apoyo para Brenda, quien se dedica cada día a ofrecer a los clientes buena mercadería.
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio, manteniendo variedad de productos de belleza, que le permitan mantener la clientela y aumentarla cada vez que sea posible, generando mayores ventas y ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Brenda is a cosmetics merchant.  She’s single living with her mother.  Her sales stand is installed in the city park and she’s open for business every day of the week.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy merchandise, above all, beauty products like make-up, lipsticks, creams and hair clips.  This investment will be of great help for Brenda who is dedicated to offer her customers good merchandise every day.

Her goal is to grown in the business having a variety of beauty products on hand that will allow her to keep her customers and increase their numbers on every possible occasion generating higher sales and profits to meet her needs.

loans.use: to buy make-up, lipstick, creams, hair clips.

loans.name: Yudaya

texts.en:
Yudaya is 43 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala Central region of Uganda.  She is married and has six children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Yudaya has a business making half bricks, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Yudaya has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase another machine that makes half bricks.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Yudaya hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  

In the future, Yudaya hopes to expand her business.    Yudaya is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase another machine that makes half bricks.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida, 52, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Narciso, a farmer, and mother of two children; both are already working. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Nida operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias, and also a variety of hanging plants and others. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP)  in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nida dreams of growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week  and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for farm inputs needed in her business.

loans.name: Freyda Indira

texts.es:
La Joven Freyda de 23 años de edad, Habita en la cuidad de Granada, es madre de dos hijos de 3 y 8 años de edad, ella es comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado. 
Ella comenzó con este negocio con el apoyo de su mama, pues su madre se dedicaba a vender mercadería en general y ella le ayudaba atender el negocio y de esta manera fue aprendiendo este oficio, después tuvo dos hijos y necesita trabajar como fuera necesario para darle de comer y de vestir a sus hijos, desde entonces se ha convertido en su único medio de subsistencia y pone esfuerzo y empeño para ir mejorando, su pequeña tienda la tiene ubicada en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Granada . 
Requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería de ropa y zapatos para niños y adultos. Esta inversión es importante pues podrá surtir su inventario de ropa nueva y variada, ofrecer mas opciones a sus clientes y mejorar sus ventas. Sus metas próximas son crecer, diversificar su mercadería.
texts.en:
The young Freyda is 23 years old and she lives in the city of Granada. She is the mother of two children, aged 3 and 8 years old. She is a merchant who sells clothing and shoes. 

She started out with this business with her mother's help. Her mother was a merchant of general merchandise and she used to help her attend the business. This is how she gradually learned the business. When she had her two children she needed to work to feed and clothe her children. Since then her business has become her only source of support and she invests her efforts and determination in its improvements. Her small store is located in the municipal market of the city of Granada. 

She requires this loan to purchase clothing and shoe merchandise for kids and adults. This investment is important because she will be able to add a variety of new clothing to her inventory. She will be able to offer her clients more options and she will improve her sales. Her future goals are to expand and diversify her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes merchandise for kids and adults.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy planks, nails and mastics used to make sofas

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 22 and married with one child aged 6. She has been in farming for 3 years in her home area of Litein, South Rift region, Kenya. Her farm produces milk and eggs which she sell on the local market.

Faith has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She says the loan will enable her to purchase a better breed for better income. She adds that her experience of three years will enable her to reap maximum benefit from the loan and raise the living standard of her family.

She remains greatful to Juhudi Kilimo for mitigating farmers' limitations with regards to finances.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena makes a living by selling fried doughnuts, moving from one place to another to serve her customers. She is a single parent who cares for six children. She also runs a business on the side making palm oil. Abena is applying for this loan to buy more of the ingredients she needs to make donuts, including flour, sugar and oil. By selling more donuts, she hopes to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make more donuts to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mop

texts.en:
Mop is a married mother of two children. She earns a living running a general store. She started this business in 2009. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Mop would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as eggs, sugar, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, and toiletries, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income, which will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods for her general store.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther  is 54  years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and has five children between 6 and 29 years old. Four are attending school and live at home while the older one is working and living on his own.

Her husband is a security man.

For the past three years she has been selling candy and biscuits in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more candy and biscuits for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more candy and biscuits for her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 48 years old and lives in South Poblacion, Larena, Siquijor. She is married with one child. To earn a living, Gina has a local food stall. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Gina has a requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase assorted ingredients for her business.
Gina has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for ten months. In the future, Gina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase assorted ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Sida Group

texts.fr:
Mme Pauline représente le groupe SIDA. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 8ans et le moins âgé a 4ans. Un va à l’école et elle a 2 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des céréales depuis 3ans. Mme s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants (TITA, TOE, LEO).Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter un sac de maïs; un sac de petit mil; un demi sac d’arachide; et un sac d’haricot.

Elle aide son mari dans les charges familiales et économise un peu. Ses ambitions sont d’agrandir son commerce (prendre des tonnes de céréales) et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Pauline represents the SIDA group. She is married and has 2 children, aged 8 and 4. One of the children attends school. Pauline is responsible for 2 people.

She has been selling grains for the past 3 years. She obtains her supplies in nearby villages such as Tita, Toe and Leo. Her customers are both men and women. She would like to buy one sack of corn, one sack of pearl millet, a half sack of groundnuts and one sack of beans. Pauline helps her husband with the family's expenses, and puts some money aside. Her goals are to expand her business (to buy grains by the ton) and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy one sack of corn, one sack of pearl millet, a half sack of groundnuts and one sack of beans.

loans.name: Hamad

texts.en:
Hamad is a 33-year-old married father of two children, one of whom is enrolled in school while the other is yet too young to attend. His wife, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of family basic needs. Hamad owns a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Hamad has operated a clothes-selling business for the past four years; his potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, and dreams of opening a cosmetics shop in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand his business, Hamad is requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to purchase more stocks of fabrics, hand bags and cosmetics for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of fabrics, hand bags and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Chuluunsuren

texts.en:
Chuluunsuren, 41, is a teacher.  She has been teaching for 7 years since she graduated from college.

She lives with her husband and daughters in Kherlen, a boundary town in western Mongolia. 

Her husband works as a fireman, but his income is not so good.  Chuluunsuren’s monthly salary does not meet her family's expenses. 

Chuluunsuren and her husband decided to start a new taxi business to increase their family's income. 

Now she needs over MNT 1.600.000 to cover the cost of purchasing a new car to start the taxi business.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing a new car to start the taxi business.

loans.name: Ezekiel Okoth

texts.en:
Ezekiel is 30 years old, single and has no children.  He describes himself as a humble, ambitious and God fearing.  

He makes and sells detergents for cleaning.  Ezekiel has been in this business for the last five years and has one employee.  His business faces a challenge of inadequate raw materials for making detergents.  He will use the loan Kes 20,000 to buy mixers, colors and rolls to be used in the making of detergents.  Ezekiel hopes in the future to run a soap manufacturing company.

loans.use: to buy mixers, colors and rolls to be used in the making of detergents.

loans.name: Espiga Y Luna Group

texts.es: La señora Graciela Silvia es nueva integrante del grupo ella solicito su prestamo para comprar blusas, faldas y pantalones de dama, el resto de las integrantes siguen en su actividad que vienen desempeñando. La joven  Miriam Karina tiene 19 años de edad, ella es soltera tiene 2 hermanos  un hermano y un hermana, ella vende ropa americana y perfumes de Jafra, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar pacas de ropa y perfumes para surtir sus pedidos, ella inicio su negocio hace un año, una amiga la invito y con un dinero que tenia ahorrado que su mama le dio, compro la paca de ropa, ella sale a vender la ropa en los tianguis más cercanos de su comunidad su hermana le ayuda a vender la ropa, su negocio es importante porque gana, se distrae y conoce diferentes lugares, ella utiliza las ganancia para volver a surtirse de ropa y para la comida, ella está contenta con el préstamo que va a recibir  va a surtir su negocio de diferentes modelos de ropa para que su clientes encuentren lo que buscan. Sus sueños y esperanzas son construir su casa para sus hermanos y ella. Las integrantes del grupo les agradecen a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad sus préstamos, gracias a ustedes nuestros negocios crecen y las familias viven mejor.
texts.en: Graciela Silvia is a new member of the group.  She is requesting her loan to purchase women’s blouses, skirts, and pants.  The rest of the members are still engaged in their activities.  Young Miriam Karina is 19 years old.  She is unmarried and has one brother and one sister.  She sells American clothing and Jafra perfumes.  She is requesting her loan to purchase bundles of clothing and perfume to fill her orders.  She started her business one year ago.  At a friend’s invitation, she bought a bundle of clothing with the money given to her by her mother that she had saved, and went out to sell it at the open-air markets closest to her community.  Her sister helped her sell the clothing.  Her business is important because she earns money, enjoys herself, and gets to know different places.  She uses her profits to re-stock her inventory of clothing and to buy food.  She is happy with the loan she is receiving.  She is going to stock her business with various styles of clothing so that her customers find what they are looking for.  She dreams and hopes of building a house for herself and her siblings.  The members of the group are grateful to Kiva and Fundación Realidad.  "Thanks to your loans, our businesses are growing and our families live better".

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothing and Jafra perfume.

loans.name: Loida

texts.es:
Loida de 31 años está felizmente casada con Pedro, con quien tiene 4 hijos de 11, 9, 7 y 3 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Loida se dedica ala agricultura en sus propios terrenos. Desde que unió su vida con Pedro emprendió esta ardua pero gratificante labor. Con el cultivo del café y el plátano le va muy bien y le da la posibilidad de generar ahorros para cualquier urgencia. “Tengo 5 cuadras, en 4 siembro café y solo en 1 plátanos”, menciona contenta de la extensión de sus terrenos.
Su prioridad es el cultivo de café por la gran demanda, pero para los gastos y necesidades diarias tiene que vender las arrobas de plátanos de sus cosechas. De 15 a 18 sacos son los que obtiene al cosechar el café, una producción nada ignorable. Le va muy bien en ese negocio.
Pero el proceso no es sencillo, el trabajo requiere tiempo y dedicación, para eso ella tiene que contratar personal para limpieza constante de sus cultivos.
Tiene muchos planes para el futuro, el más cercano es comprarse un carro de segunda mano para desplazarse con facilidad desde su comunidad hasta la ciudad. Para lograr esto deberá trabajar igual o más duro que ahora. Éste sería su primer préstamo que Loida obtendría gracias a su ayuda, de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Acaba de formar parte del banco comunal “Los Productores Yaneshas”, del que se siente emocionada por el trabajo en grupos.
Cada año fertiliza 2 veces los sembríos de café, por eso Loida invertirá todo el dinero en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Loida is 31 years old and happily married to Pedro.  They have four children ages 11, 9, 7, and 3.  They live in their own home in the community of Villa María Alto Yurinaki, province of Chanchamayo.  Loida farms her own land.  When she joined her life with Pedro, she took on this arduous but rewarding work.  The cultivation of coffee and bananas is going very well and provides her with the possibility of generating savings for emergencies.  “I have five ‘cuadras’ (a unit of land measurement = roughly 1.5 acres), and I have planted coffee in four of them and bananas in the other one “, she says, pleased with the expanse of her land.  
Her priority is to cultivate coffee to meet the great demand.  However, in order to pay expenses and daily necessities, she has to sell arrobas (a unit of measure equal to 24-36 pounds, depending on the region) of bananas from their crops.  She harvests 15 to 18 sacks of coffee, quite a substantial production!  This business is going very well.  But the process isn’t simple.  The work requires time and dedication so she has to hire laborers for constant cleaning of her crops.  
She has many plans for the future; the most immediate is to buy a second hand car in order to move easily from their community to the city.  In order to achieve this goal, she will have to work as hard, or even harder than she does now.  This would be the first loan that Loida would obtain thanks to the help of MFP; therefore she accepts responsibility for being punctual with her monthly payments.  “Los Productores Yaneshas”, a part of the communal bank, has just formed and she feels excited about working in groups. Loida fertilizes the coffee crops twice per year.  For this reason, Loida will invest all of the money in the purchase of bags of organic fertilizer

loans.use: to purchase of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Najma Group

texts.en:
Najma's age is 41; she is married, the mother of a son and three daughters, all living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has owned a ready-made ladies and children's garments business for the last six years. He purchases garment articles from the market at a low price and sells them at a profitable price at her home. He has built up a very vast pool of customers . 

The ladies like his garment collection and selection a lot. Now the summer season has started here in Pakistan. He wants to buy summer garments to sell, but he does not have the needed amount of capital due to the household expenses. Therefore, Najma requested a loan so that she can buy more attractive and quality varieties of ladies and children's summer garments to fulfill the demand. 

Najma wishes for a bright future for her children, and her dream is to provide a better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's garment business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Justin wants to construct a shelter to be selling her clothes from.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Julie is 27 years old with no children. She deals in the sale of children's wear. In addition,she sells rubber footwear for adults as well as provisions. She has this business for the past 3 years in a rented premises. She wants to utilise the KIVA loan to erect a permanent structure of her own. It is her expectation that this would help stabilise her income.

loans.use: Structure, premises

loans.name: Adolfo Javier

texts.en:
Adolfo is married and has three children aged 16, 22 and 25, who are currently studying. Adolfo used to work as an employee in a company, but the salary wasn’t large enough to cover costs once his children began to study at higher levels. Because of this, ten years ago he founded his own business as a blacksmith. At the beginning he used borrowed tools and worked from home: after three years he was able to obtain a small premises and buy the most essential tools.

In order to improve his services, Adolfo needs a loan of $1 200 dollars which he will use to purchase a metal-in-gas welder, with which he will be able to increase production and offer products of higher quality, so that the business continues expanding. Adolfo is putting in a huge amount of effort, and thanks to your support he will be able to improve his family’s quality of life; decide to help!

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer.

Adolfo es casado y tiene tres hijos, de 16, 22 y 25 años de edad, actualmente están estudiando. Adolfo trabajaba de empleado en una empresa, pero el sueldo comenzó a ser insuficiente una vez que sus hijos empezaron a estudiar en niveles superiores, de esta manera hace diez años emprendió su propio negocio en el que se dedica a la herrería. En un principio utilizaba herramienta prestada y trabajaba en su casa, después de tres años logró obtener un pequeño local y comprar las herramientas más necesarias.

Para mejorar su servicio Adolfo requiere de un préstamo de $ 1,200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de una planta de microalambre, con la que podrá incrementar su producción y ofrecer productos de mayor calidad, para continuar creciendo con su negocio. Adolfo esta dispuesto a esforzarse mucho y gracias a tu ayuda podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, decídete a apoyarlo.

loans.use: Purchase machinery

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr:
Yaovi S. was born in 1967 in Tannou (Togo), where he presently lives. He is married and father of six children. Yaovi has been given the nickname Agbléga because he is passionate about farming. He specializes in growing grains such as corn (maize) and millet. His devotion and serious work make him an exemplary farmer whose yields are often good. Because the nutrients in his soil are slowly becoming expended, however, his yields have been dropping although the demand for his crops continues to rise.

In order to revitalize his land and grow more plentiful crops, Yaovi S. is requesting a loan of $ 800. With that sum, he intends to buy fertilizer. His success in this endeavor will help him to cater for the day-to-day needs of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur S. Yaovi est né en 1967 à Tannou où il vit actuellement. Il est marié et père de six (6) enfants. Surnomé « Agbléga » à cause de sa passion pour l'agriculture, il est spécialiste dans la production des céréales comme le maïs et le mil. Son dévouément et le sérieux qu'il met dans son travail font de lui un agriculteur exemplaire qui a souvent de bons rendements. Ces rendements commencent par diminuer d'année en année à cause de l'épuisement du sol cultivable alors que les besoins alimentaires ne cessent de s'accroître.

Pour redynamiser son agriculture à travers le renforcement de la capacité de ses terres à produire, Monsieur S. Yaovi sollicite un crédit de $800 pour acheter des fertilisants. La réussite de ce projet lui permettra de bien subvenir aux besoins vitaux de sa famille.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to increase his yield

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a widow with one daughter. She lives in Melitopol in south central Ukraine. Marina sells women’s footwear in the central market. Her vending kiosk has a favorable location at the market.

Marina believes her business has benefited much from loans through Nadiya Ukraine. Her business has grown a lot in the past five years that she has been in this trade. Presently, Marina’s gross income is about $1000 a month. She has about $1400 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $400.

Marina is a successful entrepreneur and a caring mother. She always finds time for her daughter. Marina’s primary goal is to help her daughter get a good job and a stable source of income as she enters a new phase of life.

Today Marina is requesting a loan to increase her inventory. We believe Marina’s optimism, determination and will-power will help her continue to be successful and make her dreams come true.

loans.use: To increase her inventory for next season

loans.name: Metanet

texts.en: Metanet N.  is a 36-year-old woman who owns her farm in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Sabirabad region. Metanet is married and has three sons. She  works hard raising vegetables and selling them to the local bazaar traders. It brings her a profit, however she and her husband are unemployed and it is very hard to maintain the family. Only one financial source is not enough to cover family needs. As children grow up they need many expenses, such as for school supplies, clothes and other necessary things. Metanet has decided to improve conditions of her family life and applied for 1200 USD to expand her farming business.

loans.use: Going to expand her farming business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Mrs. Judith O., who is a hairdresser, is 54 yrs old, married with 7 children, and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She learned her business for a year and 6 months, and she opens her own in 2002. She is in need of a loan of $875 to enable her buy more weavon, hair cream and relaxer to sell.

loans.use: To buy more weavon, hair cream and relaxer

loans.name: Kholikova

texts.en: Kholikova I. lives in the town of Spitamen with her husband and two children. She has been a Microinvest client since 2005, and has proved herself to be a reliable and effective user of our services. Mrs. Kholikova is a very experienced in her field, which is selling small items and perfume at the local bazaar. She works with a supplier who makes goods available to her at a very low price, but competition in the bazaar is very stiff. She believes that she can improve and expand her business by offering a wider assortment of goods for sale. To do this, Mrs.Kholikova has applied for a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: To expand a business and broaden the range of products it has to sell

loans.name: Julia Liliana

texts.es:
Julia L. is a small business woman who, for more than 10 years, has dedicated herself to the clothing business, handmade by her in a small workshop inside her home, located in a poor area of Guatemala. She also offers her services in pastry making since she is trained and has obtained knowledge of pastry making, this being her secondary commercial activity. Approximately six years ago, she became a widow but she has not tired of her job since she is trying to get her four children ahead. The house in which they live is itself in the capital and located in the area described above. Recently, she has purchased an industrial machine with which she hopes to increase the production of children’s clothing since children’s clothing is what her customers request the most, some for personal use and others for resale. Julia L. is an example of tenacity, courage and dedication to her job.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Julia L., es una mujer microempresaria, que por mas de de 10 años Se ha dedicado al comercio de de prendas de vestir, elaboradas por ella misma, En un pequeño taller que funciona dentro de su casa de abitacion, ubicada en : area pobre urbana de Guatemala. Temala, tambien ofrece sus servicios en la elaboraciòn de pasteles, ya que fue ca- Pacitada, y obtuvo varios conocimientos de reposteria, siendo esta, su segunda ac- Tividad comercial. Hace 6 años aproximadamente, quedò viuda, y no ha desmayado en su trabajo, a fin De sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos. La casa donde viven, es propia, son originarios de la capital, y radicados en la di- Recciòn antes descrita. Ultimamente ha comprado una màquina industrial, con la cual espera incrementar La produccion de ropa de niño, ya que es la ropa de niño la que mas le piden sus Clientes, algunos para uso personal y otros para revender. Doña Julia L., es un ejemplo de tenacidad, valor, y dedicaciòn al trabajo .

loans.use: Purchase fabric to make dresses and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase three computers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To continue buying merchandise and to buy a freezer

loans.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.es:
Rosa R. has dedicated 9 years of her life, to selling cheese, milk and other goods. She has her own store that she runs out of her home in the community of Villanueva and in the city of Chinandega.

It is important to point out that because of Rosa’s good relationships with her customers, she has been able to earn the money need to provide for her two daughters and herself. In order to continue the sale of these products, as with all businesses, she is in need of an investment in the purchase of milk products to sell. For this reason she is asking for the support of Ceprodel and she is very hopeful that she will receive the loan that she needs to be able to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe and Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

La dama Rosa R. por mas de nueve años se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de productos lácteos como lo son queso, cuajada y leche teniendo su propio establecimiento en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Es necesario destacar que debido a sus buenas relaciones con las demás personas, ha logrado salir adelante proporcionándole a su familia (ella y sus dos hijas) un bienestar para su futuro. Para continuar con su labor de venta de estos productos, como en todo negocio ella requiere la inversión en la compra de sus productos lácteos para comercializarlos. Por esto es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel confiando que le será otorgado y de esta manera logrará mejorar la condición de su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Ibrogim

texts.en: Ibrogim J. has been engaged in the livestock business for 20 years. He developed good and special skills by watching and helping his father in the livestock in his younger years. He has a good herd (a pedigree bull and a milk cow). Mr. J. also works on a collective farm. Mr. J. has a good reputation. He is a very good family man so he loves his family and wants a good future for them. He has five children. Now Mr. J. is applying with KIVA with the request for a business development loan of 4100 STJ for 10 months. He wants to purchase rams to develop his sheep business. He thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA presents to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Ibrogim would like to purchase rams to develop his sheep business.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is single and is a successful entrepreneur from Mukachevo. Tatyana sells perfumes in one of the busy local markets. She has been in this business for about 5 years and her products have been in stable demand over the years.

Presently, Tatyana has about $2,000 in inventory. She has a long-term view of her business development and is disciplined with all her business plans. All this has promoted the successful growth of her business. Moreover, Tatyana is not afraid of serious amounts of hard work which reveal her great entrepreneurial potential and allow her to make prompt loan repayments. Tatyana is requesting a 5,000 Grivna loan to increase the variety of perfumes sold in her store.

loans.use: To increase the variety of merchandise sold in her perfume store

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou S. is a young unmarried woman who did not have the opportunity for normal schooling. She isn’t giving up and rejects idleness by working in the commerce of oranges and other goods. She is requesting this loan to boost her business, given that the month of Ramadan is looming on the horizon. It will be a time of high demand for fruit and various other goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Fatou S. est une jeune célibataire qui n'a pas eu la chance de mener ses études normalement. Elle ne désarme pas et refuse l'oisivité en menant des activités de commerce d'oranges et autres produits. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son commerce avec le mois de Ramadan qui se profile à l'horizonet qui sera une période de forte demande en fruits et autres produits divers.

loans.use: Commerce
